These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Levan will purchase grocery stock and will open a grocery store. After the grocery store is opened, Levan will be able to work and increase his income. With increased income he will be able to improve his living conditions and also expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to open a grocery store

loans.name: Claudia Leticia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  Vive a 2 kilómetros del municipio y su actividad productiva es únicamente el oficio domestico y la crianza de especies menores (cerdos y aves), por vivir en la zona rural sus padres se dedicaban a realizar lo mismo, desde su juventud sus padres les enseñaron a desempeñarse de esa manera, no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar. Por lo cual, no desea lo mismo para sus hijos, ya que estos se encuentran estudiando y apreciando esta oportunidad que les están brindando de poder ser mejores personas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y el resto para comprar alimentos para unos cerdos que poseen. Debido a costos que han tenido en las otras etapas del cultivo invirtieron lo poco de lo cual ella y su esposo disponían; por lo que el financiamiento es una alternativa para continuar trabajando y no estancarse en la producción. Con la inversión, busca garantizar su seguridad alimenticia y tratar de generar otros ingresos que les permitan mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos en cuanto a salud, educación y enseñarles a  valorar la cosas.


Ellos desean ser, excelentes padres que sus hijos se sientan orgullosos de ellos y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia, 40, is married and has five children.  She lives two kilometers from the town and her productive activity is domestic chores only and raising small animals (pigs and fowl).  Because she lives in a rural zone, her parents did the same thing and since her youth her parents taught her to develop the same way; they never had the opportunity of going to school.  Because of this, she does not want to do the same for her children; they are attending school and appreciating this opportunity they are getting of becoming better people.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy fertilizer to grow 7,000 square meters of corn; the rest is to buy feed for some pigs they have.  The loan is a financial alternative so they can continue working and not stop production because costs in other production phases used up the little money they had.  With this investment she seeks to guarantee food security and to try to generate other income so that their children’s health and education conditions can improve and to teach them to value things.  They want to be excellent parents that their children can be proud of and to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Undrah

texts.en: Undrah is 56 years old lives alone in Ger in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His children are married and live with their families. Undrah has been providing welding services at home since 1999. He officially made this a business in 2002 and established his reputation as a welding service provider well-known in town for quality service. He is now requesting 400,000 MNT loan to purchase metal materials to produce chimneys and other metal products to sell to his clients. He is a hard-working, enthusiastic and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase metal materials to produce chimneys and other metal products to sell to his clients

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 44años es un hombre muy trabajador  y por ello día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante en su pequeño negocio como albañil y pintor, ya que Jose es padre de un hijo de 17 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y sobre todo se sacrifica para poder darles una vida digna y también para poder brindarle mejores oportunidades que las que el tubo.

Es por ello que Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá comprar una compresora, ya que es de mucha utilidad en su trabajo y actualmente tiene que alquilarla, de esta  manera Jose podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá cumplir mejor su trabajo, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder tener un gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old. He is a very hardworking man, and because of this, day after day he tries to get by in his small business as a construction worker and painter, since Jose is the father of a 17-year-old son, whom he loves very much; and above all, he makes sacrifices to be able to give him a decent life and also to be able to give him better opportunities than he had.

This is why Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their great support he will be able to buy a compressor, which is very useful in his work. Currently he has to rent it, and by buying it he will be able to increase his income and do his work better, which will allow him to continue to strive to make his biggest dream a reality: “To give his son a trade and to be able to have a great business.”

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Ccolque T Ikari - Chocopia Group

texts.es:
Nicolaza tiene 41 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella vive en la comunidad de Chocopia en el distrito de Colquepata y donde realiza sus actividades diarias, ella se dedica a la confección y a la costura de ropas. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar hilos, telas, botones, lana y otras cosas más.  

Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Ccolque Tikari - Chocopia” en el distrito de Colquepata. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado y  a la crianza de animales menores. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La foto de la persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión).

(En el distrito de Colquepata y está dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
texts.en:
Nicolaza is 41 years old and married. She is a responsible and friendly person who progresses and moves forward with her family. She lives in the community of Chocopia in the district of Colquepata, where she goes about her daily work. She sews and tailors clothing. For this opportunity, she needs a loan to purchase thread, fabric, buttons, wool, and other items.

A group of neighbors and friends formed the Ccolque Tikari - Chocopia Communal Bank in the district of Colquepata. This communal bank is composed of several people who are looking at every moment for opportunities to move forward, and, with their daily effort, to secure a better future for their children. The members work in agriculture, ranching, food sales, fattening pigs, and raising small animals. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to make their payments on time and in the agreed upon manner. (The person who appears in the inset photo asked permission to not be present for the meeting.)

(In the district of Colquepata and in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco)

loans.use: purchase thread, fabric, buttons, wool, and other items.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 57 years old, and lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, along with his wife and three children. The family owns a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local markets and to the resellers. This is the only source of the income for the family, which is rarely enough for food for them. 

Tengiz has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and  the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tengiz requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup with credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Tengiz will open a café and he will purchase all the needed inventory and products. Tengiz is very experienced in this field, as he had this business seasonally on the seaside in the Anaklia district. He wants to start the café again, but this time in the capital city, as the income will be more stable. 

Tengiz and his wife will work hard in the café and try to do their best to satisfy the client’s needs.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give them an opportunity to earn more income and significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase the products and inventory needed to start a café

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 37-year-old lady; she is running a small general store in the corner of her house. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for Rs. 20,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will enable her to consistently meet the increasing demand. She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates for her general store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old, married man, from Jabalia City. He lives in the city with his wife. 

Mohammad has been working in his grocery store for two years. It is a profitable business, but it needs more improvements.

Mohammad is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stocks of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and milk. The loan will also help Mohammad make improvements in the store's condition, such as installing additional shelves and painting. This will increase sales and increase Mohammad's income.

loans.use: to purchase needed stocks of basic groceries and to pay for improvements in his store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza city; he appears in the photo. He is the father of two sons. Ahmad has had a taxi for four years; it is a profitable business, but not enough to cover all the family's needs. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new engine for his taxi, since the old one needs fixing every few months. This new engine will improve the car's capacity, as well as Ahmad's income.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 29-year-old married lady, and the mother of two children, ages 2 and 5. She operates a green grocery stall alongside her husband's workshop, and has been in the business for the last four years earning a monthly income of kes 25,000.

She learned about KADET LTD from a loan officer who was conducting a marketing campaign in her area of work. She has acquired a second loan of kes 30,000 which will help her buy more fruits and vegetables from farmers, and transport them to her premises. She will use the proceeds to pay school fees for her children.  

Her dream is to own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase and transport fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarmagnai is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ger, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife, Buyanhishig, is 33 years old and works at a local medical resort as a chef. His two children study at a local school. 

Bayarmagnai has been manufacturing wooden furniture at home and is now planning to make it his official business. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to build a small workshop on his plot of land in order to start his wooden furniture manufacturing business. He is a hardworking, diligent and responsible man.

loans.use: to build a small workshop on his plot of land in order to start a wooden furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is a 58-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She has been involved in milk sales for the past 20 years. 

She has five calves and six buffaloes for her business. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with the butter and cheese she makes from the milk. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase one more buffalo, and feed for its calves. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. 

She wishes to spend part of the revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo, and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Maryuri Esperanza

texts.es: Maryuri, de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de la Managua, tiene 1 hijo de dos años, ella es dueña de una pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace 1 año con la necesidad de conseguir ingresos para ayudar a mantener a su familia, y la pulpería es un negocio que produce ingresos diarios  y al mismo tiempo le permitía estar más cerca de su hijo.  El padre de su hijo le dio un poco de dinero para que iniciara y así lo hizo con solo la venta de dulces, pan, huevo, café, detergente y jabón estos fueron sus primeros productos. Hoy en día vende leche, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, enlatados  ha ido surtiendo su negocio poco a poco tiene más clientes, además que en donde vive no hay muchas pulperías cercas.  Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos, aceites, leche, productos de limpieza. Pues su idea es ampliar su pulpería y agregar la venta de cosméticos pues aun de este tipo de productos no vende.
texts.en:
Maryuri, 23, lives in the city of Managua. She has a two-year-old son and owns a small grocery store. She started this business a year ago with the need to earn income to help support her family. 

The grocery store generates daily income and at the same time allows her to be closer to her son. Her son’s father gave her some money to start it and that’s how she did it, by just selling candy, bread, eggs, coffee, detergent, and soap. Those were her first products. 

Nowadays, she sells milk, rice, beans, sugar, and canned food. She has been gradually stocking her grocery store and has more customers. There aren’t many grocery stores near where she lives. 

She is requesting this loan to buy staple grains, oils, milk, and cleaning products. Her idea is to expand her grocery store and add the sale of cosmetics, since she doesn’t sell that type of product yet.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, oils, milk, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Petit Grabo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Petit Grabo 1 fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 14 personnes. 
Bazom a 45 ans. Il s’occupe de 10 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 1 an qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 4 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
"Petit Grabo 1" is a group which is part of the Coopagui cooperative of Guiroutou, a small village located in southwestern Côte d’Ivoire in the region of San Pedro.  The group comprises 14 members.

Bazom is 45 years old.  He takes care of 10 people in his household.  He joined the Coopagui cooperative one year ago and he has 4 hectares (9.88 acres) of land on which he grows cocoa which is UTZ and Rain Forest Alliance certified, which means that Bazom is respecting the standards and principles of sustainable farming.

Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy products which will improve the health of his crops (phytosanitary products).  These products will allow him to increase his production and thereby his revenues.

With any remaining money, Bazom plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy products which will improve the health of his crops (phytosanitary products).

loans.name: Nafiseh

texts.en:
Nafiseh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Nafiseh is a Palestinian married woman from Beit Hanoun. She lives in a simple house with her husband and four kids: two boys and two girls. Nafiseh's husband is a worker who earns a low wage. This is the only source of income for the family. 
Nafiseh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay for a new bedroom for her kids and will provide the family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new bedroom for her kids

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama, a 29-year-old single man who lives in Attel village near Tulkarm, was working for a very low wage, so he opened his own barber shop two years ago. His business is profitable and earns a good income, but it needs some improvements.

Osama has requested a ISD loan from FATEN to buy tools necessary for his barber shop and to do some shop decoration. This loan should lead to an increased income.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his barber shop and to do some shop decoration.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a green house

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Fatmeh is a 28-year-old, married woman from a small neighborhood in Jabalia. She lives in a humble house with her husband and three children; two sons and one daughter. Fatmeh's husband works as a worker and this is the only source of income for the family. 

Fatmeh would like to improve the family's home and its conditions by buying the necessary furniture and home appliances. So, she took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Fatmeh to buy new furniture, especially for the living room.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and home appliances.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for loan of 1,600,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and hair oils. She generates additional income from rental rooms. 

She works in the shop and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and off and on electricity. 

She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build her own business premises. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and the rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and hair oils.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 50 years old. He sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sweet potatoes, cooking oil, and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more sweet potatoes, cooking oil, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 19 years old. He runs a small store where he sells grocery items to the people in his area. From this, he earns a small amount, which is not enough for  sustenance. He started his business selling his products in the street; then he was able to expand his business to open a grocery. 

He is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He aims to increase his profits, but has had inadequate funds to invest in his business. Now he is asking for a loan of 200,000 YER. This will be used to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store. He hopes to have a car to facilitate carrying his goods to his store from the market.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат трудолюбивый и очень активный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат, но детей пока не имеют. Но вместе со своей женой Шавкат очень любит детей и хотят иметь большую семью. Чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь и иметь постоянный доход Шавкат начал своё дело. И вот уже как 2 года он занимается выращиванием картофеля. Он имеет небольшой участок земли, где и выращивает свой урожай. Каждый сезон он собирает хороший урожай картофеля, затем продаёт выращенный картофель на местном рынке и  получает хороший доход для своей семьи. В местности, где он живёт, Дехканство является одним из прибыльных бизнесов. Многие мужчины в округе занимаются этим бизнесом. И для того, чтобы быть  конкурентоспособным, Шавкат хочет увеличить свой бизнес, а именно он хочет посеять лучший сорт картофеля. Для этого ему нужны денежные средства. Сейчас Шавкат обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки семян картофеля, чтобы расширить свой бизнес. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Shavkat is a hardworking and very active 30 year-old man.  He is married, but does not yet have children.  But Shavkat and his wife love children very much and want to have a large family.  Shavkat started his own business in order to earn a living and have a regular income.  It has now been two years since he got involved in growing potatoes.  He has a small plot of land, where he grows his harvest.  He gathers a good potato harvest every season, then sells the potatoes at a local market and earns a good income for his family.  Dekhan farming is one of the profitable businesses in the locale where he lives.  Many men in the area are involved in this business.  In order to stay competitive, Shavkat wants to increase his business by planting the best variety of potatoes.  He needs money for this.  Now Shavkat came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to purchase potato seeds in order to expand his business.  He hopes very much for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Zohrah

texts.en:
Zohrah is a 46-year-old married woman doing a business of milk sales for the past 20 years. She has five calves and two cows in milk; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

She has five children; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior. Now, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, age 44 is a house wife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a furniture shop, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Salma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase wood, cardboard, sheets, glue, and nails for manufacturing furniture.

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Salma hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood, cardboard, sheets, glue, and nails for manufacturing furniture.

loans.name: Abdel- Raouf

texts.en:
Abdel-Raouf is a 41-year-old married man from Jenin city. He is a father with three sons and two daughters; all of them are under 18 years old. 

Abdel-Raouf works as a school manager, after having worked many years as a teacher in the local schools. 

Abdel-Raouf took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to complete his new home by buying construction materials and buying some necessary home appliances. By applying for this loan, Abdel-Raouf's family's living conditions will be better.
 
Abdel-Raouf appears in the Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and buy some necessary home appliances.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 49-year-old vigorous lady. She has four children; among them, three are school-going. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband. They offer various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of their community and make enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of the business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Miraflores De Challabamba Group

texts.es:
Juana Maria tiene 39 años de edad y es separada de su pareja, ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella vive en el distrito de Challabamba  a 30 minutos en carretera de la ciudad principal de Paucartambo y donde realiza sus actividades diarias, ella se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas, huevos y aves de corral. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carnes rojas y gallinas.  

Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Miraflores de Challabamba” en el distrito de Challabamba. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado y  a la crianza de animales menores. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las fotos de las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión).

(En el distrito de Challabamba y está dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
texts.en:
Juana María, 39, is separated from her spouse.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family.   She lives in Challabamba District thirty minutes by highway from the main city of Paucartambo where she carried out her daily activities.  She sells red meats, eggs and barnyard fowl.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy red meats and chickens.

A group of friends and neighbors formed the “MIraflores de Challabamba” communal bank in Challabamba District.  This communal bank consists of several people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort to provide a better future for their children.  The members work in agriculture, raising livestock, selling foodstuffs, fattening up cattle and raising small farm animals.  In general, the members are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments as scheduled.  

(The people in the photos inserted at the bottom asked permission to miss the meeting.)  (Challabama District is in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.)

loans.use: to buy red meats and chickens.

loans.name: Rio Mapacho Group

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 31 años de edad y es casada, ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia, ella vive en la comunidad de Huaccancca que está en el distrito de Challabamba y donde realiza sus actividades diarias, ella se dedica a la venta de hortalizas y verduras pues ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz y verduras. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos.  

Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Rio Mapacho” en el distrito de Challabamba. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la venta de comestibles, al engorde de ganado y  a la crianza de animales menores. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

(El distrito de Challabamba y está dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
texts.en:
Francisca, 31, is married.  She’s a kind, responsible woman who supports her family.  She lives in the community of Huaccancca in Challabamba District where she carries out her daily activities.  She works selling vegetables for she has several parcels of land where she grows potatoes, corn and vegetables.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy seeds and manure.

A group of friends and neighbors formed the “Río Mapacho” (Mapacho River) communal bank in Challabamba District.  The communal bank consists of people who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort provide a better future for their children.  The members work in agriculture, animal husbandry, selling food, raising livestock and small farm animals.  In general, they are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various payments as scheduled.
(Challabama District is in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Gulbony

texts.ru: Гулбону добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Гулбону 5 лет назад обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она в течение 5 лет успешно ведет свой бизнес. Она занимается купле продажей хозяйственных товаров. Гулбону год за годом усовершенствует свои знания, и постепенно развивает бизнес. Она данное время хочет пополнить оборотный капитал. С полученного дохода, она собирается улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки товара. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulbony is a conscientious woman.  She is married and raising four children.  Five years ago, Gulbony completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a cerificate.  She has been successfully running her business for five years.  She is involved in buying and selling household goods.  Year-after-year, Gulbony improves her knowledge and gradually develops her business.  At the present time, she wants to refill her working capital.  She plans to use the resulting income to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase merchandise.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy household goods in order to refill her working capital

loans.name: Las Sonrientes Group

texts.es: Este grupo formado por tres microempresarias de éxito una de ellas es Xiomara, mujer casada, de 41 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat y Vogue actividad que viene realizando desde hace 17 años. Este crédito lo utilizara en la compra de cosméticos como perfumen de dama, perfumen de varón, cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, cremas faciales, delineadores, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, máscaras, tintes  para cabello, champo, etc. Natalia tiene 22 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y chinelas y Raquel tiene 33 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful micro businesswomen.  One of them is Xiomara, a married 41-year-old woman.  Her business is selling Avon, Zermat and Vogue cosmetics, an activity she’s been doing for 17 years.  She will use this loan to buy cosmetics like women’s perfume, men’s perfume, hand cream, body cream, facial cream, eyeliners, nail polish, lipstick, mascara, hair color, shampoo, etc.

Natalia, 22, sells clothes and slippers and Raquel, 33, sells Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Erlinda Maribel

texts.es:
Erlinda tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella realiza los oficios domésticos en cu casa y ordeña dos vacas, la leche que obtiene de ellas la vende y de ahí obtiene ingresos económicos para sus gastos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un toro, para que cargue a sus dos vacas y haga crecer la ganadería. Con la inversión, ella esta evitando andar buscando el toro prestado a otras personas y corre el riesgo que la golpeen ya que no tiene mucha fuerza para andar de un lado a otro.
texts.en: Erlinda, 65, is a widow; she has six adult children.  She does her domestic chores at home and milks two cows.  She sells the milk she gets earning income for her expenses.  The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a bull so that it will impregnate her two cows to increase her herd’s size.  She’s trying to avoid having to look for a bull to borrow from other people because she runs the risk of being hurt because she doesn’t have the strength to be going from place to place any longer.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Yency Nohemy

texts.es:
Yency tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de tres años de edad. Ella realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa, tiene una carrera universitaria pero no ha podido conseguir trabajo y a opado por trabajar en la ganadería.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas y aumentar la producción de leche. Ella manifiesta que desea aprovechar hoy que esta joven y con mucha energía apara trabajar y brindarle a su hija lo necesario.
texts.en:
Yency is 33 years old and she is a single mother of a three year old girl. She does all the domestic chores in her house and she has a university degree, but she wasn't able to get work and so she decided to work with livestock. 

The loan she is asking for from Fundacion Campo is to purchase cows and increase her milk production. She has demonstrated that she wants to take advantage of this opportunity while she is young and has the energy to work and to give her daughter all that she needs.

loans.use: purchase cows and increase her milk production.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (Kuña Pyapy Mbarete) está en su segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, son mujeres trabajadoras  donde todas se ayudan por salir adelante, están contentas y con mucho entusiasmo de formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres, ya que de esa forma podrán seguir creciendo en lo que cada una hace.
Jenny es una de estas mujeres, ella es vendedora, tiene una pequeña despensa en la que trabaja desde tempranas horas todos los días. Se define a si misma como una persona que lucha por su familia, para poder darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Su sueño es poder crecer con su negocio y darles también a sus clientes todo lo que buscan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes lo que necesita. Quiere comprar verduras, frutas, leche, panificado, y demás.
texts.en:
The group called “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” is in its second in the women’s committee program.  They are hardworking women who help each other out in order to get ahead.  They are happy and very enthusiastic about forming part of the women’s committee program because this way they will be able to continue growing in what each one of them does.

Jenny is one of these women.  She sells.  She has a small store that she works in every day starting in the very early hours.  She defines herself as a person who fights for her family to give them everything they need for their day to day.  Her dream is to be able to grow with her business and give her customers everything they are looking for.

She requests this loan to buy stock merchandise for her store to continue providing what her customers need.  She wants to buy vegetables, fruit, milk, baked goods and others.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, milk, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Abeer is a married woman from Deir Ebze'e, a small village near Ramallah. She is a mother with five sons and five daughters. Abeer's husband works as a worker with a seasonal job. Abeer and her husband would like to complete their new home and live in it. 

Abeer took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy construction materials for the family's new home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for the family's new home.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Se dedica  a la agricultura desde muy temprana edad; lo aprendió de sus padres. Los insumos los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a seis kilómetros de distancia, por lo que debe pagar un vehiculo para que los traslade hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 18 sacos de fertilizantes, foliares y pago del alquiler del terreno en donde cultivara 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión, aplicara los insumos a tiempo y en la medida correcta para obtener una buena cosecha, para vender una parte y la otra la dejara para consumo de su familia. En el futuro desea, disponer de capital propio para realizar sus cosechas, brindar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 42, married, and has four children aged 14, 12, 9, and 6. From an early age, he has made his living in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. He gets his supplies from a city that is six kilometers away, so he has to hire a vehicle to transport them to his house. 

The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to pay for 18 sacks of soil fertilizer, liquid fertilizer applied to the leaves, and rent on the land where he will cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn. With this investment, he will be able to treat his fields on time and in the correct amount in order to obtain a good harvest so he can sell part of it and keep the other part for his family's consumption. In the future, he hopes to have his own capital so that he can reap his harvests and give his children the opportunity to go to school.

loans.use: to pay for 18 sacks of soil fertilizer, liquid fertilizer applied to the leaves, and rent on the land where he will cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Consuelo Del Socorro

texts.es: Consuelo, de oficio comerciante , es dueña de una pulpería vive en la ciudad de Managua , ella comparte su  experiencia al ser beneficiada con su primer crédito Kiva , pues tuvo la oportunidad de surtir más su negocio pues compro jugos, productos de limpieza, snacks etc. Todos productos que se consumen a diario sus clientes y de los cuales no puede carecer. Esta agradecida por permitir tener el financiamiento en el momento que lo necesita y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio. Hoy el financiamiento lo está necesitando para comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos,  detergentes, cloro, papel higiénico, avenas, enlatados, shampo, jabones de baños etc. Pues su idea es seguir ampliando su pulpería atravez de la compra de más productos y mantener su negocio estable y próspero que le permita sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
A saleswoman, Consuelo is the owner of a small grocery store. She lives in the city of Managua. She shares her experience of the benefits from her first Kiva loan; she had the opportunity to stock her business more, as she bought toys, cleaning products, snacks etc., all products that her clients consume on a daily basis and that she can't be without. She is grateful to have been allowed the financing when she needed it and thus make her business grow. 

She currently needs financing to buy basic grains, dairy products, detergents, bleach, toilet paper, oatmeal, canned goods, shampoo, bath soaps, etc. Her intention is to keep expanding her grocery store through the purchase of more products and to maintain her stable and prosperous business that allows her to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, detergents, bleach, toilet paper, oatmeal, canned goods, shampoo, bath soaps, etc.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been working as an animal trader for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

In order to purchase two more goats, Fozia contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. With this loan, she is sure to expand her business and income level. She wishes to provide quality education to her children so they will have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Jeejan

texts.en: Jeejan is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has been running a business of animal sales for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and raises them.  Then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation.   Currently she has requested a loan of Rs.35,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good loan history. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nergis

texts.en: Nergis, age 37, deals in the business of cloths sales. She initiated her business to support the needs of the family members. She is mother of three and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become popular in her street for selling good quality cloth in her community. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth of the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.  In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth of the summer season by taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: Jose, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Jose, se dedica al cultivo  de café, cuenta con su propio cultivo, la producción en pergamino húmedo la vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y para limpieza de la misma y poder sacar buena producción. Su plan es poder obtener mas terrenos para ampliar el cultivo y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is 33 years old, is married, has two children and lives in a village that is part of the city of Gracias, Lempira. Jose makes a living by growing coffee. He has his own crop, a wet parchment production he sells in the local market.

He has decided to ask for a loan for 15,000 Honduran lempiras to buy fertilizers, to clean his coffee and to be able to get a good production. His plan is to be able to get more land to expand his cultivation, and for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to do maintenance on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Francisca Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Gema tiene 28 años de edad, acompañada y con un hijo menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de queques, churros y tortas desde hace 8 años. Vende sus productos en su casa y ambulante en su comunidad. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años y el crédito lo solicita para invertir en la compra de productos como queques, pasteles, churros, tortas, pudines, etc., Julia es una mujer que tiene 49 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno y José tiene 58 años y su negocio es la venta de frescos.
texts.en: This groups is made up of three enterprising members, one of them is Gema, who is 28 years old and accompanied by her young son. In her business, she has been selling cakes, churros, and more for 8 years. She sells her products from her house and also as a street vendor in her community. They have been a client of this financial institution for 4 years and they are asking for a credit to invest in purchasing cakes, pastries, churros, puddings, and more. Julia is 49 years old and she specializes in baked goods and Jose is 58 years old and he specializes in selling refreshments.

loans.use: purchasing cakes, churros, pastries, pudding etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de la ciudad de San Ignacio, el esta estudiando la carrera de Veterinaria en una de las mejores universidades del país. Cuenta que su sueño es poder ayudar a los animales que tanto les gusta. Se esfuerza por su familia para poder darles una pequeña ayuda por medio de su profesión.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales de estudios, como así también pagar sus clases. Esta agradecido ya que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man from the city of San Ignacio.  He's studying to be a veterinarian in one of the best universities in the country.  He says his dream is to be able to help the animals he loves so much.  He works hard for his family, so he can give them a little help through his profession.

He's requesting this loan to be able to invest it in buying study materials as well as to pay for his classes.

He's grateful because this loan will be a lot of help to him.

loans.use: to buy study materials and to pay for classes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 51 year-old single mother.  She sells cereals, and now beauty products as well.  She has been in the cereals business for thirteen years and gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Gladys' third loan from KADET LTD., and she plans to use it to expand her cereal business by purchasing more cereals.  She also wants to revamp her cosmetics shop.   In the future, Gladys looks forward to opening her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beans, green grams, and peas for sale.

loans.name: Yonyu

texts.en:
Yonyu is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married. Yonyu was unable to go to school. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  

For the past ten years, Yonyu has been selling rubber dishes from a small shop in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 8am to 5pm. She enjoys her business because of the flow of her customers since she sells quality products. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Most of the time, she uses a shared-bus to get her goods to her shop. 

Yonyu is requesting a loan to purchase rubber dishes, such as plates, tubs, buckets, bowls, and spoons for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes, such as plates, tubs, buckets, bowls, and spoons for her business.

loans.name: Elbegsaihan

texts.en:
Mr. Elbegsaihan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in a ger in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife Minjbadgar works at local company. His oldest daughter graduated and started working, the second oldest daughter studies at university and the youngest daughters study at a local secondary school. 

Elbegsaihan started manufacturing wooden furniture at home in 1984. He has already became well-known with his tasteful and qualified products among clients. He has got an order and needs 550,000 MNT to purchase the necessary inventory to manufacture the furniture for his client. He is a hardworking and diligent man who dreams of getting all his daughters educated and able to live on their own.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary inventory to manufacture the furniture for his client.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 22-year-old single man from Tulkarm. He has been managing a coffee shop for two years. It is a profitable project but needs more development. Odai would like to re-decorate his coffee shop. 

Odai took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of developing his coffee shop by redecorating his business. 

Odai appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of developing his coffee shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Rosa mujer de 40 años, acompañada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 7 años, sus productos los comercializa ambulantes en empresas privadas y a su comunidad. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de varón, camisolas, blusas, faldas, pantalón de vestir de damas, etc. Marling es una mujer de 40 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y Cira tiene 50 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three successful entrepreneurial women partners. One of them is Rosa, a 40-year-old woman in a relationship with two children. Her business for the last 7 years has been the sale of new clothing. She sells her products in an itinerant fashion to private businesses and in her community. She is asking for the loan to buy new clothing like men's pants, women's pants, men's shirts, camisoles, blouses, skirts, women's dress pants, etc. 

Marling is a 40-year-old woman and her business is the sale of new clothing, and Cira is 50 years old and her business is the sale of new clothing.

loans.use: to buy new clothing like men's pants, women's pants, men's shirts, camisoles, blouses, skirts, women's dress pants, etc.

loans.name: Ganhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Ganhuu is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Harhorin soum of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife Densmaa is 44 years old and runs the butcher shop with her husband. His son Gansuh is 22 years old and is a new graduate currently looking for a job. His daughter Gantsetseg is 20 years old and is a sophomore student at university. 

Ganhuu has operated a butcher shop in a local market since 1996 with his wife. They purchase livestock from herders in the countryside and sell to local and Ulaanbaatar customers. They built a close relationship with their suppliers and clients over the years. He is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to pay his daughter's tuition fees and cover her living expenses in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fees and cover her living expenses in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina lives in Likoni Kenya. For the last three years she has been involved in farming as a business. She plants crops and takes care of them until they are ready for harvesting then she sells this crop in the local market. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds for her farm. She has two employees who help her in activities on the farm. The challenge she faces is the lack of rain. This causes her to incur losses. She is a married woman and a mother of three children all of whom attend school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and employ skilled labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has four children and has been doing this work for 30 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling eggs'. Her biggest challenge is 'Raising poultry feeds.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Bahati.'

Agnes was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Quick loan processing.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That you must save at least 15 percent of the loan.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How would this loan benefit her family?', Agnes replied 'Will educate them.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Agnes owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
Mr.Lhagvajav is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in Harhorin soum of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Oyuntsetseg, is 57 years old and runs a small souvenir stall close to the tourist attraction points of Uvurhangai province. 

Lhagvajav has retired and stays home; he helps his wife run her souvenir retail business. He crafts wooden toys and souvenir products at home; he is now making it a business.  He sells his products at his wife's stall, which is close to an old traditional monastery and other tourist attractions. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory to produce wooden toys and souvenir products. He is a hardworking and talented craftsman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to produce wooden toys and souvenir products

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 43-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer with a low salary and income. It was very tough for Yasmeen to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business selling animals. 

She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them in the market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of PKK 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés, Korotoumou est une femme qui exerce l’activité de transformation des céréales locales depuis 20 ans. En plus de la transformation, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisines et des pagnes afin de se procurer plus de revenus dans le but de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille. 

Soucieuse de la nécessité de protéger l’environnement et aussi et de la satisfaction des besoins de ses coépouses, Korotoumou a décidé de devenir un partenaire de Nafa Naana afin de pouvoir vendre des produits énergie tels que les foyers améliorés, les foyers à gaz et les lampes solaires. Cependant, elle est confrontée à une difficulté financière qui limite sa capacité d’approvisionnement en produits pour la revente. Grâce à ce prêt, Korotoumou pourra acheter 10 foyers améliorés, 5 à gaz et 14 lampes solaires qu’elle revendra afin de se procurer des revenus supplémentaires.
Ces revenus serviront à accroître son activité, et elle rêve d’atteindre une autonomie financière en perpétuant l’activité au secteur 5 de Ouagadougou où elle réside et exerce son commerce.
texts.en:
Married with five children all in school, Korotoumou is a woman who has been running her business of processing local grain for the past 20 years. In addition to processing grain, she also sells kitchen utensils and pagnes (traditional West African dyed cloth) to earn more income in order to contribute to her family's expenses.

Mindful of the need to protect the environment and also the needs of her co-wives, Korotoumou decided to partner with Nafa Naana in order to sell products such as energy efficient stoves, gas stoves and solar lamps. However, she faces financial hardship that limits her ability to purchase a supply of products for resale. With this loan, Korotoumou will be able to buy ten energy efficient stoves, five gas stoves and 14 solar lamps that she will resell to earn revenue.

This income will serve to help her business grow. Korotoumou dreams of achieving financial autonomy through the expansion of her business in Sector 5 of Ouagadougou, where she resides and runs her business.

loans.use: to buy ten energy efficient stoves, five gas stoves and 14 solar lamps for resale.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Mr.Lhagvasuren is 26 years old, a newlywed,  and lives with his wife in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Alimaa, is a senior student at a local university. 

He used to help his father to manufacture custom wooden furniture, and gained a lot of experience. He is now starting his own business of furniture manufacturing in his home to cover his family expenses, and pay his wife's tuition fee, etc. 

He is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase the inventory to start manufacturing wooden furniture for local clients. He is a hardworking, honest, and open-minded person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start manufacturing wooden furniture for local clients.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellos es Domingo hombre de 50 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de llantas de vehículos livianos y pesados desde hace 8 años. Tiene un año de ser cliente de la institución, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de llantas para carros livianos y vehículos pesados, Yolanda tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de verdura, leche, cosa de horno y Blanca tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group comprises three enterprising members, one of whom is 50-year-old Domingo.  He is married and has two children.  For eight years, he has had a business selling tyres for light and heavy vehicles.  He has been with the communal bank for a year and will use this loan to buy tyres for light and heavy vehicles.  Yolanda is 54 years old and has a business selling vegetables, milk and corn cakes.  Yolanda is 51 years old and sells new clothes.

loans.use: to buy tyres for light and heavy vehicles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old, and lives in Montserrado County that has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has two children aged 26 and 18 years old. Only one lives at home and attends school. She did not attend school, and she describe herself as a very hard-working woman.

For the past four years she has been operating a table business where she sells rice, charcoal, oil etc in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband who sells fire-coal by the bag. She enjoys her business because the business gives her additional money. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses the bus to get her goods to her table. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory such as rice, charcoal, oil etc for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as rice, charcoal and oil for her business.

loans.name: Jano

texts.en:
Jano is 24 years old. He lives in Kobuleti District with his mother. Jano requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Jano has a flat, which is rented out seasonally. His mother works as a cook in a local restaurant.  It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Jano requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Jano has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Jano will open an auto car wash. He will purchase a special apparatus, which is used for washing cars. After beginning the business he will be able to work hard and increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open an auto car wash.

loans.name: Saiah

texts.en:
Saiah is 35 years old, and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is  married and has two children ages 3 and 6 who live at home and are in school. 

Saiah was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. She describes herself as very hard-working woman.  For the past ten years she has been selling rice, charcoal, oil, etc from a table in the local market; she started this business with money given to her by her husband, who sells charcoal by the bag. 

She enjoys her business because it gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 8 am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a bus to get the goods for her table. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, bitter ball (a vegetable), oil, okra, etc. for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, bitter ball, oil, okra, etc for her business,

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora Maria luisa, de 41 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, se dedica al negocio de tortillas las vende en el barrio. Este negocio  lo empezó cuando sus hijos estaban pequeños no podía dejarlos solos entonces se puso a hacer unas cuantas tortillas las cuales vendió entonces con poco dinero lo pudo conseguir lo cual le ha ayudado a salir adelante ahora  sus hijos están grandes y le ayudan con lo que ganan. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de maíz y leña, tiene como meta futura mejorar las condiciones de su casa y como meta próxima vender más tortillas para obtener ingresos cancelar su crédito y componer  el servicio higiénico de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 41 years old and is from the city of Estelí. She makes a living from the business of tortillas and sells them in her neighborhood. She started this business when her children were small; she couldn't leave them home alone so she made a few tortillas that she sold. With little money she was then able to accomplish what has helped her to get ahead. Now her children are grown up and they help her with what they earn.

She is asking for this loan to buy corn and firewood. She has the future goal of improving the conditions of her house and the immediate goal of selling more tortillas to obtain earnings to pay off her loan and to repair the hygienic system in her house.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwanatambwe est trésorière du groupe de crédit « Changamuka » entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 7 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chômeur. La cliente est vendeuse de produits brassicoles (Primus, Fanta, Coca, etc.). Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il ya environs 20 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  5 casiers de Primus, 5 casiers de Fanta, 1 casier de Mutzig. Les pertes de change, les impayés  sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Mwanatambwe is the treasurer of the Changamuka loan group. A brave entrepreneur, she is 40 years old and a mother of seven children, who all go to school. Her husband is unemployed.

Mwanatambwe sells [alcoholic and non-alcoholic] drinks (Primus, Fanta, Coke, etc.). She started this business with money received from her husband about twenty years ago. 

This new loan will serve to buy five cases of Primus, five cases of Fanta, and one case of Mutzig. 

Losses and unpaid bills are major challenges to the development of her business. 

In the future, she wishes to expand her business, build a house, and educate her children.

Mwanatambwe thanks Hekima for their support to women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy five cases of Primus, five cases of Fanta, and one case of Mutzig

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nyogbo Group

texts.en:
The seven members of the Nyogbo No group are married women who, on average, are 30 years old and have two children each. 

They have joined the micro finance institution ID-Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities in all seasons.  They are on their third loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

The featured borrower, Abigail, sells assorted soap and detergents.  In the photo, she is standing at the back with a detergent in her hand.  She plans to use her GHS 1,000 loan to buy three boxes of soap and one box of detergent.  She buys from the wholesale depot and sells to her customers inside and outside Teshie.

She is expecting to make a profit of GHS 200 after the sale of these boxes of assorted soap. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

The other members are Jully, Selina, Offie, Okailey, Naomi and Rebecca.  They need a total amount of GHS 4,600 so that they can expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of soap and one box of detergent, sell to customers.

loans.name: Murodilla

texts.ru: Муродилла добрый и целеустремленный человек. Ему 49 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 10, 11 и 3 года. Он заботливый отец и муж. Муродилла более 5 лет занимается купле - продажей скота. Данное время он имеет 2 голов крупно – рогатого скота и 5 голов мелко – рогатого скота. Муродилла очень трудолюбивый человек и поэтому он упорно трудится для того, чтобы развевать бизнес. Муродилла запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Murodilla is a good and purposeful man. He is 49 years old. He is married and raising three children. The children are 10, 11 and 3 years old. He is an attentive father and husband. 

Murodilla has worked with animal sales for more than 5 years. Currently he has two heads of cattle and 5 sheep and goats. Murodilla is a very hardworking man and therefore he works persistently in order to develop his business. 

Murodilla requests a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock to increase his turnover. He awaits your kindness. This loan will help him improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purhcase livestock for increasing working capital

loans.name: Ehawa

texts.fr: Ehawa est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un chaudronnier. Elle a 02 enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a 16 ans et le dernier a 12 ans. Ehawa travaille comme revendeuse de produits de beauté depuis 2004. Elle revend dans une boutique au public et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Ehawa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté. Elle veut améliorer son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Ehawa is a 39-year-old woman who is married to a boilermaker. She has two children, both in school. The oldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 12. Ehawa has been working as a retailer of beauty products since 2004. She sells to the public in a store and gets her supplies in Lomé. Ehawa has requested her third WAGES loan to purchase some beauty products. She wants to improve her business and meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Confianza Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores uno es Mauricio con edad 49 años , casado y con 3 hijos su negocio es la venta de res en pie y destace de cerdo desde hace 22 años consecutivos. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de res y cerdos, Guadalupe tiene 59 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Socorro tiene 54 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa y calzados.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three entrepreneurial partners, one of whom is Mauricio. He is 49 years old, is married and has three children. For the last 22 years, his business has been the sale of live cows and the butchering of pigs. He will invest this loan in buying cows and pigs.  

Guadalupe is 59 years old and her business is the sale of cosmetics, and Socorro is 54 years old and her business is the sale of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy live cows and pigs.

loans.name: Pearl's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of two borrowers. One of them is Pearl, a 43-year old woman, who has two grown children. Her business is the sale of tomatoes. She has been in this business for four consecutive years. She supplies this product in her community to all customers who want to retail from her. Her oldest daughter helps her manage the business. She travels to the farms and buys in boxes.

She has been a client of ID-Ghana for four years. She will invest this loan amount of GHS 2,500 in the purchase of four boxes of tomatoes to supply to customers.

Dickson is 40 years old, she's a seamstress and together they need a total amount of GHS 4,000 to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase of four boxes of tomatoes and supply to customers.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is selling milk, and his biggest challenge is feeding the livestock.  Animals on the farm are not named.

Erick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "quick loan processing".  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro finance training session and he stated, "That there are two grace periods".

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Erick replied, "I improve their livelihood".

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Erick owns the following:  a cow, poultry, a bicycle, but does not own 'a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net, electricity, and TV', but does not have 'solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
En su décimo ciclo está este trabajador grupo de Ciudad del Este, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una, del cual 2 mujeres se encuentran con bajos ingresos.
Ylda, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel bajo de ingresos cuenta que se está esforzando el doble para poder ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, las cuales según sus clientes son muy ricas, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comestibles y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This working group from Ciudad del Este in its tenth loan cycle. The members are taking a poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with each of their situations. Two of the women are at a low-income level.

Ylda, who is at a low-income level, doubles her efforts so that she can improve her life and that of her family. She sells food, which her customers say is very tasty. For this reason, she is doing very well. Ylda is requesting a a loan in order to buy vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and other supplies so that she can continue preparing food and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mongontuya

texts.en:
Mrs.Mongontuya is 23 years old  and lives with her husband and son in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Mongontulga, works at a local cobbler company. 

Mongontuya gave birth to her son Monhbat a year ago, and has just started working following her maternity leave. She and her husband are now starting a cobbler business at home during their off-duty time in order to increase the family income.  Since they have a newborn baby, family expenses have gotten raised a bit. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase leather and other materials to produce shoes to sell to local clients in order to increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other materials to produce shoes to sell to local clients in order to increase the family income.

loans.name: Maleo

texts.en:
Maleo is 40 years old and married. He supports a family of six children ranging one to twelve years of age. He has been a wheat and barley farmer for the last 15 years with a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is servicing his 8th loan of 90,000 KES from KADET LTD., and this will facilitate him in purchasing farm inputs as well as hire farm  machinery.

He hopes to use anticipated profits to expand his farm and re-invest. His future dreams are to improve the families living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Erwin Jose

texts.es: Erwin,  es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, es casado y tiene dos hijos, edades d 18 y 22 años, uno estudia en secundaria y la otra en la universidad. Es lisiado de guerra y recibe una pensión, con fondos propios inicio su negocio de pulpería hace aproximadamente 12 años, apoyado por su familia. El negocio se ubica lo tiene en su casa de habitación, le gustaría hacer crecer su negocio surtiendo de productos  para satisfacer a sus clientes y captar más personas de los barrios aledaños y por ende mejorar sus ventas y su calidad de vida. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, pasta de dientes, papel higienico, detergentes, jabon,cloro y surtir también en golosinas. Sus metas  Futuro son terminar de preparar a sus hijos y mejorar la productividad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Erwin is a native of the city of Estelí. He is married and has two children, ages 18 and 22; one is in high school and the other at university. He is a disabled veteran and receives a pension. He started his grocery store with his own money about 12 years ago, with the support of his family; the store is in his house. 

He would like to grow his business by stocking products to satisfy his customers and attract more people from the neighborhoods nearby, and consequently improve his sales and his quality of life. He will invest this loan in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper, detergent, soap, bleach, and also sweets. His future goals are to finish raising his children and to improve the productivity of his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, toothpaste, toilet paper, detergent, soap, bleach, and also sweets.

loans.name: Tiessiri  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  TIESSIRI II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Kenikela un des villages de la commune de Massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
