Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAMINA la première personne à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0.5 Ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the TIESSIRI Ii group are married women who average 39 years of age and three children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in the village of Kenikela, in the commune of Massigui (prefecture of Dioïla), in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to better organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. Their crops include groundnuts, rice, and a bit of millet. This is their 7th loan cycle with Soro Yiriwaso.

MAMINE, sitting first from the right, plans to use this loan to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and to pay for the plowing of approximately 0.5 hectare of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele composed of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average profit of about 75,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy inputs, pesticides, fertilizers, and small farming tools, and to pay for the plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Shadrack's Group

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 29-year-old single man. He describes himself as creative and persistent. He operates a second-hand shoe and block business where he sells the shoes and blocks at a profit. He has been involved in this business for six years. He business is located in a busy environment. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate capital to expand the business. He will need a 1,000 GHS loan to add more shoes and cement to his business. This is his seventh loan application with ID-Ghana.

Together with Fuatina, he needs a total amount of 2500 GHS to improve businesses. They are part of a mother group called Thy Will.

loans.use: to add more shoes and cement to his business.

loans.name: Seyar

texts.en: Seyar lives in West Point one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She is 37 years old and she did not attend school.  She is unmarried and has six children between the ages of 10 and 20, two of which are in school and they all live at home.  For the past 10 years now she has been involved with the sales of green potatoes in the local market.  She received a small amount of money from her mother to establish her business, and she learned this way of trading from her.  She likes her business because she makes profits.  She is requesting a loan to purchase green potatoes to increase her business.  Her plans are to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes to increase her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí y estudia Veterinaria en una de las mejores universidades del país. Vive con sus padres, su mama es docente jubilada y su papa es chofer jubilado.
Con la educación que recibe con el tiempo sueño con recibirse, abrir su propia veterinaria en su ciudad y ser de mucha utilidad para su comunidad. 
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo, ya que le permite seguir estudiando. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de transportación, ya que con ello podrá ir mejorando y creciendo.
texts.en: María is from the city of Paraguarí and is studying Veterinary in one of the country’s best universities.  She lives with her parents and her mother is a retired teacher; her father is a retired driver.  She hopes in time to graduate with the education she’s getting and to open her own veterinary clinic in her city and to be of much use to her community.  She’s grateful for this opportunity for progress she’s getting because it allows her to continue studying.  She’s asking for this loan to pay transportation costs because with it she’ll be able to continue improving and growing.

loans.use: to pay university transportation costs.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en: Batbileg is 44 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in a ger in Songinokhairkhan district Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He started his business four years ago, by planting organic vegetables and fruits. He plants organic vegetables and fruits on his land outside of Ulaanbaatar city (the capital). His wife sells organic vegetables and fruits, from a rental counter at the market. He has been running his business successfully since he started it in 2008. He also started building a storage pit and planning to store organic vegetables and sell during winter time when the price is higher than at other times of the year. He is a hard-working and diligent man whose dream is to educate all his children. He is now requesting a 6,000,000 MNT to cover plantation expenses of his organic vegetable and fruits in his plot of land.

loans.use: to pay plantation expense of his organic vegetable and fruits in his plot of land

loans.name: Zeby

texts.ru: Зеби 59 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 совершеннолетних детей. Ее муж пенсионер и получает маленькую пенсию. Поэтому Зеби является основной кормилицей в семье. Зеби очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она более 13 лет трудится упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить семью. Она занимается купле продажей мужской обуви. Она хочет развевать бизнес, так как она нуждается в больше деньгах, чтобы обеспечить семью. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для покупки мужской обуви для пополнения оборотного капитала. Этот займ поможет ей развевать бизнес и увеличить доход, что позволит ей улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zeby is 59 years old. She is married and has two adult children. Her husband is retired and receives a small pension. Therefore, Zeby is the only breadwinner in the family.

Zeby is a very hardworking woman. She has worked persistently for more than 13 years on order to earn money and support the family. She works with selling men's shoes. She would like to develop her business, as she is in need of more money in order to support her family.

Zeby requests a loan in the amount of 4,500 somoni for the purchase of men's shoes to replenish working capital. This loan helps her develop her business and increase the income, which will allow her to improve her living conditions. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase men's shoes for increasing working capital

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
Maro is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at the local school. She lives in Isahakyan village, which is located in one of the biggest regions of Armenia: Shirak.

Maro lives with her husband (in the photo), 7-years-old daughter (in the photo) and her in-laws.
 
The whole family is involved in agriculture. They are running a farm which currently includes 50 chickens, 3 goats, 12 cows and 10 calves. They also own a plot of agricultural land where potatoes, barley and wheat are cultivated. Maro and her mother-in-law milk cows and make cheese and other dairy products from it. The men gather the harvest and sell it in the local markets. Over the years, this family's products have become popular and now they have their loyal buyers who prefer to buy agricultural products only from them.

By requesting this loan, Maro wants to purchase forage for feeding the livestock, seeds for cultivation and fuel for taking the gathered products to the market. The loan is very important for this hardworking farmer's family, who do their best to improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for forage, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 5 children and has been doing this work for 30 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling farm products.' His biggest challenge is 'Raising funds.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Joseph was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'it has approachable officers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That loans are given to those in a group.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?', Joseph replied 'Will educate his children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joseph owns the following: 'a cow, poultry, a motorcycle' but does not own 'a pig, a pump, a bicycle, an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net, electricity, a sewing machine, a TV, a DVD' but does not have 'solar power, or running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Mario Alexis

texts.es: Mario, tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira.  Mario es una persona muy trabajadora desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura. Actualmente tiene una parcela cultivada de café en el terreno de su casa. La producción la vende en el mercado local y es su fuente de ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y limpieza del cultivo. El espera sacar mayor producción en al próxima cosecha. Su meta es mejorar su condición de vida, ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y ampliar la finca.
texts.en:
Mario is 24 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Gracias, Lempira.

Mario is a hardworking individual who has been working in the field of agriculture from a very young age. He currently has a parcel of land at his home where he grows coffee. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market, thus this is a source of income.

The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 25,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers, compost, and payment for the clearing of his fields. He hopes to achieve better production for the next harvest. His goals are to improve his living conditions, help his children with their studies, and expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost and to pay for the clearing of his fields.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es Docente de la ciudad de Pilar, es separada, y cuenta que esta enseñando en una escuela de su ciudad.  Ella tiene una hija pequeña, por quien lucha y se sacrifica día a día para poder darle todo lo que ella no puedo tener.
Estudia la carrera de especialización en evaluación, ya que por medio de esos estudios podrá seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su hija, Ella es una persona con mucho entusiasmo y quiere seguir luchando por sus seres queridos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en su gasto de titulación, ya que por medio de esto podrá pagar todos
texts.en:
Lucia is a teacher in the city of Pilar. She and her husband are separated. She tells us that she is teaching in a school in the city. She has a young daughter, and sacrifices and works very hard for her every day so that she can give her daughter everything she was unable to have.
She is studying to specialize in assessment. Through these studies, she will be able to grow and improve her life and that of her daughter. She has a lot of enthusiasm and wants to keep fighting for her loved ones.
She is requesting this loan to invest in her tuition costs, since she will be able to pay it all with this loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs.

loans.name: Sady

texts.es:
Sady es una persona joven que trabaja y estudia, ella está acompañada, y tiene un hijo de dos años, quien es su mayor inspiración, y por quien lucha, para poder crecer y darle todo lo que necesite el día de mañana.
Actualmente trabaja en una cafetería, pero está estudiando la carrera de enfermería. Cuenta que su sueño siempre ha sido ayudar a las demás personas, y es por eso que está estudiando esta carrera.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en gastos de la universidad, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando y dándole a sus estudios el tiempo que merecen.
texts.en:
Sady is a young woman who works and studies. She has a partner and a two-year-old child who is her greatest inspiration and for  whom she works very hard so that she can provide for every need.
She currently works at a cafe, but she is studying nursing. She tells us that her dream has always been to help others, and that this is why she is studying nursing.
She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in university costs. With this loan, she will be able to continue to study and give her studies the time they require.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu is 59 years old, lives with his wife and son in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Tseveen is retired and stays home taking care of her husband and son. His older son married and lives with his own family now. His youngest son Jargalsaihan is 16 years old and studies auto engineering at a local college. He started his business with his older son and is successfully running it with help of his wife and young son now. 

He is now requesting 4,500,000 MNT to pay his son's college tuition and purchase tools for his business. He is a hardworking man who says "I will run this business with my youngest son and I already started training him"

loans.use: to pay his son's college tuition and purchase tools for his business

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.es: Miroslava, de 41 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene  04 hijos de 20, 09, 06 y 04 años de edad, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Miroslava se dedica al transporte para eso cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con su propio capital hace 03 años, el cual da en alquiler a un chofer que recorre todas las calles de su ciudad buscando clientes para brindar su servicio. Le gusta su actividad pues le brinda los ingresos económicos y le permite tener un oficio ya que no conseguía un empleo estable, además de poder manejar su propio tiempo y sentirse independiente. Considera su negocio bastante rentable ya que el transporte le está generando muy buenas ganancias. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y crecer, deseando comprarse otra unidad de transporte  e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi.
texts.en: Miroslava, a 41-year-old woman, is divorced and has 4 children, ages 20, 9, 6, and 4, who live in her house. Miroslava works in transportation. She owns a mototaxi that she bought 3 years ago with her own funds, which she rents to a driver who goes through the streets of the city searching for clients to whom to provide service. She likes this activity because it provides her with income and allows her to have a profession, since she has not been able to find a stable job. In addition, she is able to manage her own time and feel independent. She considers her business fairly profitable since transportation is generating good profits for her. Therefore, she plans to expand her business and grow. She would like to buy another transportation unit to increase her income. This is her first loan with Kiva, so she hopes for your collaboration so that she can achieve her goals. With the loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy replacement parts for the maintenance of her mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Everline Wangui

texts.en:
Everline is a 26 year old who is not married, but she supports one child, who is six years old.  She has been in the agriculture business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Everline is qualified to get a third KADET LIMITED loan of KES 30,000, with which she plans to purchase more fertilizers and pesticides to boost her agricultural business.

She intends to use her anticipated profits to expand her farming. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to grow financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pestcides for her crops.

loans.name: Grace Njambi

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old, is not married, but supports three children. She has been in the agriculture business for the last seven years with a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Grace qualified for a third loan from KADET LTD., of 30,000 KES which she plans to use to purchase crop chemicals and pesticides for her crops. 
The anticipated profit will expand her business as well as help in buying bulls for fattening then selling .

Grace hopes and dreams of becoming a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase crops, chemicals and pestcides for her crops.

loans.name: Mukue

texts.en:
Mukue, a hardworking 46-year-old farming at the slopes of Mau forest in Narok county, Kenya, is married and has five children aged 15, 13, 10, 8 and 5 years of age. He has been growing wheat for the last 12 years, making a monthly income of Kes 50,000.

Mukue is taking his fourth loan of Kes 50,000 to hire a tractor for ploughing. He also intends to purchase more wheat seedlings. The area enjoys two seasons per year and hence is an environment very conducive to agriculture. He will use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as meet his family's basic needs.

Mukue's dream is to expand his business so that it becomes a highly profitable commercial venture.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза девушка 28 лет. Замужем мать троих детей. Наргиза трудолюбивая, жизнерадостная девушка.  Муж Наргизы находится на заработках в Российкой Федерации. И ежемесячно отправляет ей денежные средства. Сама Наргиза портниха. С детства Наргиза любила шить и на каникулы  ходила к портнихе, чтобы научиться этому ремеслу. Наргиза шьёт национальные платья. У неё хорошая фантазия. Она рисует фасоны и представляет своим клиентам для выбора. Клиенты Наргизы довольны, тем что она очень пунктуальная и аккуратная портниха. Наргиза старается в указанный срок закончить пошив платьев своих клиентов. Несмотря на не очень большой доход Наргиза и её муж купили дом, сделали застройки. В 2012 году она брала кредит в организации Арванд и на эти деньги они построили кухню и баню. Тем самым улучшили условия  жилья. Её семья очень довольны. И по этому Наргиза хочет опять взять кредит и отремонтировать свой дом.  На полученный кредит планирует купить строительные материалы.  Наргиза  очень благодарна организации Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a young woman of 28 years. She is married and the mother of three children. Nargiza is a hardworking and cheerful woman. Nargiza's husband is working in the Russian Federation, and sends her money every month. 

Nargiza is a seamstress. Since childhood she loved to sew and during the vacation she went to the dressmaker to study this craft. Nargiza sews national dresses. She has a great imagination. She draws styles and presents her customers with a choice. Her customers are satisfied that she is a punctual and accurate seamstress. Nargiza tries to finish sewing her customers' dresses within the specified time. 

Despite a small income, Nargiza and her husband purchased a house and did work on it. In 2012 Nargiza took a loan from the organization Arvand, and for this money they built a kitchen and a bathroom. This way they improved their housing conditions. Her family was very happy, and currently Nargiza would like to take another loan and refurbish her house. For the loan received she plans to purchase building materials. Nargiza is very thankful to the organization Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Marcelo es un joven de la ciudad de Villarrica, el es un estudiante que se esfuerza ya que el día de mañana quiere ser un gran profesional.
Cuenta que desde hace 9 años que trabaja para poder estudiar. Su carrera es la de administración y contaduría pública.
Su aspiración es ser alguien en la vida, un buen profesional para poder dar fruto a su familia que son los que me inspiran día a día para salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma cubrir este gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a young man from the city of Villarrica. He is a student who works very hard because he wants to be a great professional in the near future.
He tells us that he has been working for nine years to be able to study. He is studying public administration and accounting.
His goal is to be someone in life, to be a good professional in order to provide for his family. His family inspires him day to day to move forward.
He is requesting this loan to pay university fees, thus covering this cost.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Purevhuu

texts.en: Purevhuu is 34 years old and lives with his wife in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Ariunhand is a teacher at a local school. Purevhuu has been helping his mother to run her clothing retail business in the local market since he was a little kid. He is now starting his own business of sport clothes retail in the local market and requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of sports clothes from China to sell to local customers. He has regular customers and is well-known for his tasteful and assorted selection of clothing in the local market. He is hardworking and an open-minded man.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of sports clothes from China and sell to local customers

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine lives in the Litein area of Kenya. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops. She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 13 years. 

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking' Her biggest challenge is 'Feeding animals.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Josphine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That loans are given to those in a group.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Josphine replied 'It will educate them.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Josphine owns the following: 'a cow, poultry, a pump' but does not own 'a pig, a bicycle, a motorcycle, an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net, electricity, a TV, a DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, or a sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.  He has three children, and has been doing this work for nine years.  

He stated that the most enjoyable thing about farming is egg collection.  His biggest challenge is treating poultry. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "The low interest rate."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  "That members in a group must be able to approve a group member to take a loan," he replied

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, David replied, "I will be able to educate them."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns a cow, poultry and a bicycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, a TV and a DVD, but does not have solar power, running water or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Gracious

texts.en: Gracias, a married man who lives in a semi-permanent home, is a coffee farmer. Gracias owns a very big shamba of coffee from which he earns money to educate his children. However, he has been contending with deteriorating yields in recent harvests due to soil exhaustion. Gracias has therefore requested this loan of Ugx.1,500,000 to buy manure for his plantation.

loans.use: To buy manure

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en: Saruni is a 26-year-old man who supports a family of three. He has been in the agriculture business for the last 6 years with a monthly income of about KES 15,000. Saruni qualified for a third loan from KADET LTD of KSH 40,000, with which he plans to purchase young bulls for fattening. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more bulls. His hope and dream is to achieve his goal of becoming a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció, de 45 años de edad, está casada con Wister y tiene 03 hijos de  17, 09 y 6 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Roció se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas en su casa propia, su puesto está ubicado en el frontis de su casa en donde pone una mesa todos los fines de semana y venden sus comidas, logrando tener una buena acogida entre sus clientes, realizando estas actividades con el apoyo de su hija mayor desde hace 02 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos que necesita para pagar sus gastos de su hogar. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecido por el apoyo de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará bebidas al por mayor para su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Rocio, 45, is married to Wister and has 3 children aged 17, 9 and 6, with whom she lives with in her own home. Rocio has a business selling food and drinks from her house.  Her sales post is located at the front of her house, where she puts out a table every weekend and sells her food.  Her business has been well received by her customers, and she's been doing this work with the help of her oldest daughter for 2 years.  

Rocio enjoys her business because it generates very good income, which she needs to pay the household bills.  This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the support of being able to access a line of credit to continue her business.

With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles she request, she will buy drinks at wholesale for her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, esta luchando y poniendo todo de si para mejorar su vida y la de su familia por medio de sus estudios. Cuenta que gracias a su familia esta cumpliendo su meta, ya que siempre la han apoyado.
Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, ya que así podrá tener un alivio con ello y poder centrarse en sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, lo cual le permitirá estudiar.
texts.en:
Julieta is studying commercial engineering. She is fighting hard and doing her best to improve her and her family's quality of life by means of her studies. She says that she is reaching her goal thanks to her family, who have always supported her.
Julieta is asking for a loan to pay the university fees. In this way she will have some relief and will be able to concentrate on her studies. She is grateful for this opportunity which will allow her to study.

loans.use: to pay for college fees.

loans.name: Sigei

texts.en:
Sigei lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 2 children and has been farming for 14 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Feeding animals", and his biggest challenge is "raising funds". Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Sigei was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "the low interest rate".  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He responded, "that there is a grace period."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Sigei replied, "I will be able to educate them."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sigei owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 43 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County.  She was unable to attend school, but she says she is good at managing business. She is single, and has four children  between ages 21 and eight.  Three of them are in school and live at home.

For the past fifteen years, Emma has been selling  charcoal from a small shop in the local market.  She has lot of customers and makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. 

She hopes to improve her business, and to send her children to become educated.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en:
Mrs.Tsengel is 26 years old and lives with her husband and a son in an apartment in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Bathuyag, works at local state-owned organization. Her son, Telmuun, is 3 years old and just enrolled in the local kindergarten. 

Tsengel has been working as a saleswoman for years and is now planning to start her own retail clothing business in the local market now that she is coming back from her maternity leave. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase baby clothing from Beijing, China, to start her clothing business in a local market. She has years of experience and good taste in clothing choices.

loans.use: to purchase baby clothing from Beijing, China, to start her clothing business in a local market.

loans.name: Munh-Yurtunts

texts.en: Mrs. Munh-Yurtunts is 37 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger on her sibling's plot of land in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter, Doyoddulam, is 14 years old and studies at the local school. Munh-Yurtunts started her business of clothing sales in a rental stall at a local market in 2002. She has built close relationships with her customers and wholesalers in China over the years. She has good loan records on her previous loans at XacBank. She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventory from Erlian, China, to sell from her stall in the local market.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory from Erlian, China, to sell from her stall in the local market.

loans.name: Allakabon Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Allakabon II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Sinsinsa Kinisso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil avec Wassa, 3 ème assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, de la semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1/2 hectare de mil. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Allakabon II" are married women averaging 39 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in Sinsinsa Kinisso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their farm work better during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with Wassa, who is the third person sitting from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about ½ hectare of millet.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village of Koutiala to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of 85,000 francs CFA at the end of planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and equipment

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtuya is 38 years old and lives with her husband and a son in a ger in the Dornogovi province of Mongolia. Her husband, Suhbaatar, is 48 years old and runs a small stationary store in a rental stall in the local market. Her son, Mandah-Orgil, is a 13-year-old local music and dance school student. 

Enhtuya started her business of raising poultry in 2011 on her plot of land. She has previous experience of working at a farm and has built her customer base already. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more chickens to expand her poultry and produce more eggs to sell to local customers. She is a bright, hardworking and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to expand her poultry and produce more eggs to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 58 años de edad, es padre de 06 hijos pero vive al lado de uno de sus hijos en su casa propia.  Antonio se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de algunos productos regionales, tales como arroz, yuca,  plátano todos estos productos los siembra en su terreno agrícola en la que lleva trabajando por 20 años y aprendió mucho desde entonces, se inicio sembrando solo cacao  pero su deseo de superarse hizo que empezará a ver otros productos y así obtener mas ingresos. Se siente muy cómodo con lo que hace, le esta yendo muy bien ya que su producto es esperado por muchos compradores en la ciudad y eso le genera buenos ingresos, vende el plátano, yuca y arroz a una industria cerca de su chacra y los demás en los mercados de la ciudad, tiene muchos planes a futuro y así poder mejorar sus sembríos. Este será su primer crédito con Kiva y está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3500 soles, comprará abono orgánico para mejorar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Antonio is 58 years old. He has 6 children but lives with only one of them in a house he owns. Antonio grows and harvests local products such as rice, yucca, bananas, etc. He plants these products in his cropland, which he has been cultivating for 20 years. He has learned a lot since he started. At first he only grew cocoa but his desire to get ahead made him start to grow other products to increase his income.
Antonio feels comfortable doing his work and he is doing well. His products are awaited by many customers in the city and this generates good income for him. He sells the bananas, yucca and rice to an industry close to his farm. He sells the rest of his crops at the markets in town. He has many plans for the future, to improve his crops. 
This will be Antonio's first loan with Kiva and he is happy to know that he will have the financial support to allow him to move forward. For this reason, he is committed to paying his loan fees in a timely manner. With the amount of 3,500 Nuevos Soles from the loan, Antonio will buy manure to improve his crops.

loans.use: to purchase manure.

loans.name: Maurino

texts.es: Maurino  tiene  62 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, vive junto a su esposa en su casa construida a base de madera, Maurino tiene un pequeño taller donde elabora muebles y otros artículos de madera, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su tío el cual le enseño esta actividad, pero ya con el paso delos años optó por abrir su propio taller. Gracias a su trabajo pudo ser el sustento de su esposa y enviar a sus hijos a la escuela con la intención de que se puedan superar y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Maurino cuenta con una parcela de 2 hectáreas en donde trabaja cuando no tiene pedidos pendientes en su taller de carpintería. Es el primer préstamo con KIVA y espera contar con el apoyo financiero para seguir adelante con su negocio razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad está solicitando 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera.
texts.en:
Maurino is 62 and is married with two children. He lives together with his wife in his house, which is constructed with wood. 

Maurino has a small workshop where he makes furniture and other wood objects. He learned this trade thanks to his uncle, who taught him, but over the years, he decided to open his own workshop. Thanks to his work, he has been able to be a lifeline for his wife and send his children to school, with the intention that they will be able to overcome and have a better quality of life. 

Maurino relies on a two hectare plot where he works when he doesn't have orders pending in his carpentry workshop. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he hopes to count on financial support to move forward with his business. For this, he promises to pay his dues in a timely fashion. For this opportunity, he is asking for 1,000 new soles to purchase wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.es: Zosima tiene 55 años, es madre soltera con 3 hijos, junto viven en una casa rustica. Zosima se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cacao y café orgánico. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos de cultivo para hacer el respectivo mantenimiento a sus plantaciones con la ayuda de algunos trabajadores del lugar, Zosima usa abono orgánico para fertilizar su terreno de cultivo para así mejorar la calidad de su cosecha. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y espera contar con su apoyo financiero para continuar con la actividad económica que viene realizando para así cumplir todos sus objetivos. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
55-year-old Zosima is a single mother.  She has three children and they live together in a house made from rustic materials.  Zosima is a farmer who grows organic cacao and coffee.  Every morning she heads off to her farmland where she cares for her crops with the help of some local workers.  She uses organic fertilizer to fertilize her farmland so that she can improve the quality of her harvest.

This is Zosima's second loan from Kiva and she hopes to be able to count on their financial support so that she can continue in her business and achieve all of her goals.  On this occasion, she would like to borrow 2,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer with which to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Allakabon I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Allakabon I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Sinsinsa Kinisso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec Fanta Alou , 2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Allakabon I" are married women averaging 39 years of age and seven children each, all living in traditional families in Sinsinsa Kinisso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of aMali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of carrying out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crops grown are peanuts and millet, as is the case with Fanta Alou, who is the second person standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village of Koutiala to a men and women customers. She plans on making an average profit of 125,000 francs CFA at the end of planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and equipment

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronicah lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and her job salary.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Gaining profit from farming." Her biggest challenge is "Funds." Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Veronicah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Their low interest rate."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "That they organize workshops for farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit her family", Veronicah replied, "I will be able to educate them."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Veronicah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to continue horticultural farming.

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenebileg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons in a small house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Regzen, and sons, Uuganbayar and Baigalhuu, provide inter-city transportation services. 

Erdenebileg started her business in the local market in 1990. She has been doing various types of businesses and is now starting a retail construction supplies business in a rental stall of a local market. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her new business. 

She is a hardworking and open-minded woman who says, "Recently, a lot of construction companies are building new apartment buildings and office buildings in town, so a retail construction supplies business will be successful in the long run."

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her construction supplies business.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia, de 53 años de edad, es  madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos de 20 y 14  años de edad. Juntos viven cómodamente su casa propia. Octavia se dedica a dar el servicio de transporte, por está razón alquila su mototaxi a su hijo mayor, recibiendo así un buen porcentaje de dinero. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite solventar sus gastos familiares, iniciándose por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad para seguir adelante. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenas resultados. Por tanto, tiene planes de crecer y poder comprarse otras unidades para así ampliar su flota de vehículos. Por tanto éste será su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Octavia, 53, is a single mother; she has two children who are 20 and 14 years of age.  They live comfortably in her own house.  

Octavia provides transportation services; she leases her mototaxi to her eldest son and keeps a good percentage of the money.  She likes the business because it allows her to earn income to cover family expenses.  It started because she needed to have a reliable source of income because she had been unable to find employment.  Now, she feels more sure of being able to continue forward.  

On the other hand, however, she comments that she doesn’t like it when her mototaxi breaks down often because she incurs many costs but even like that she still manages to see good results.  Therefore, she plans to grow and to be able to buy more units to expand her vehicle fleet.  

This will be her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s getting to reach her goals.  She will use the requested 3,000 new soles to buy spare parts to service her mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to service her vehicle.

loans.name: Petit Guiglo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Petit Guiglo fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 6 personnes. 
Burkawendin a 60 ans. Il s’occupe de 14 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 1 an qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 9 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il souhaite pouvoir scolariser les enfants dont il a la responsabilité.
texts.en:
The group "Petit Guiglo" is part of the cooperative "Coopagui" and is located in Guiroutou, a small village in southwestern Cote d'Ivoire, in Région de San Pedro. The group is composed of six persons.

Burkawendin is 60 years old. He takes care of fourteen persons at home. He has been part of the Coopagui cooperative for a year, and he has nine hectares of cocoa with UTZ and Rain Forest Alliance certification, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture. 

Thanks to this loan, he is going to be able to purchase pesticides for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues.

With the additional money, he would like to provide schooling for the children he has responsibility for.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 35 años, está casado con Claudia y tiene 3 hijos, juntos viven en una casa construida a base de adobe, su principal oficio es la agricultura, actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de cultivo donde siembra cacao orgánico, además de otros productos como el barbasco y palillo. Edwin contrata trabajadores del lugar los cuales tienen que limpiar la mala hierba y extraer los tallos defectuosos, además para mejorar la calidad de sus productos se suele usar abono orgánico porque considera que usar fertilizantes artificiales deteriora la calidad de sus terrenos de cultivo a largo plazo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1,000 nuevos soles contratará trabajadores del lugar, quienes le ayudaran a trabajar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Edwin, 35, is married to Claudia and has three children.  They all live together in an adobe house.  His main occupation is agriculture.  

He currently has two hectares where he grows organic cocoa beans as well as other things like barbasco [evergreen bush] and palillo [similar to guava].  Edwin hires local laborers to clear the bad weeds and pull up the defective stems.  Also, in order to improve the quality of his products he tends to use organic manure because he believes that using artificial fertilizers deteriorates the quality of his land in the long run.  

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels very grateful for the financial support he gets to continue forward with his business.  He will use the requested 1,000 new soles to hire local laborer who will help him work his land.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana es de la ciudad de Caacupé, ella viene de una familia humilde, trabajan vendiendo bebidas y comestible normalmente, con la ayuda de su marido también. Ella es una mujer que quiere seguir creciendo, por lo que está estudiando para poder superarse.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y cuenta que su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en el centro de salud de su Ciudad y de esa manera ayudar a varias personas que necesitan y también tener un ingreso más para su hogar.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder cubrir las cuotas del año. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Eliana is from the city of Caacupé.  She comes from a humble family that works selling soft-drinks and food normally usually with help from her husband.  She’s a woman who wants to continue growing which is why she’s studying in order to improve.  She’s studying Nursing and she relates that her hope is to complete the career and start working in her city’s health center to help the various people who need it and also to earn more income for her home.  She’s requesting this loan to be able to pay tuition fees for her university and to be able to pay them for the entire year.  She’s grateful for this opportunity she’s receiving.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es de Ciudad del Este, comenta que la vida del estudiante es muy sacrificado debido al costo que implica estudiar la carrera que está siguiendo, la cual es de odontología, además del esfuerzo de asistir a clases todos los días sin importar la lluvia, el frío.
Además cuenta que ella proviene de una familia trabajadora, sencilla y muy sacrificada, ya que con el esfuerzo de sus padres sus hermanos y ella pudieron estudiar. Mi meta a futuro a que quisiera llegar es de tener mi propio consultorio. Mis aspiraciones es llegar a ser una buena profesional y capacitarme día y mi inspiración es mi familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar sus útiles de la universidad y también para poder utilizarla en sus gastos de manutención.
texts.en:
Aída is from Ciudad del este.  She comments that life as a student is very demanding because of the cost involved in studying the career she is, Dentistry, as well as for the effort involved in attending classes every day despite the rain and cold.

She also comments that she comes from a working, unassuming, very self-sacrificing family because it’s been thanks to her parents’ and her siblings’ efforts that she’s been able to study.  Her future goal is to have her own dental office.  Her goal is to become a good professional and to become more skilled every day; her inspiration is her family.

She requests the loan to be able to buy her university textbooks and also to pay for her food costs.

loans.use: to buy her university textbooks and pay food costs.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 30 yrs. old with 5 children to look after. His wife died sometime back. He lives in a semi-permanent house. From his coffee plantation, he has managed to construct a permanent house for his children. His main challenge is that he lacks money to pay for his children's tuition on time. He has therefore requested UGX 500,000 to help him pay his children's school fees and also buy fertilizers for his plantation.

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Tsedendamba

texts.en:
Mr. Tsedendamba is 52 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in a ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife, Buyantsetseg, herds livestock in the countryside. His daughter, Tsetsegdelger, is 25 years old and works as a saleswoman in his retail clothing store in a rental stall at a local market. 

Tsedendamba has been running his retail clothing business with his daughter since 2010. They already have regular clients and are now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase seasonal clothes from China to sell from their rental stall. Tsedendamba and his daughter are hardworking and enthusiastic people.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothes from China to sell from their rental stall.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es de la ciudad de Ybycui, es una persona que se está esforzando mucho por poder ser una profesional el día de mañana y sentirse útil.
Ella comenta que vive en la casa de sus padres, y que por las mañanas va al hospital de la ciudad a hacer su pasantía, y por las tardes va a la universidad. Ella está estudiando la carrera de Bioquímica, y desea el día de mañana poder ayudar por medio de sus conocimientos en algún hospital.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad, con lo cual podrá liberarse de ese gasto y dedicarse de pleno a sus estudios. Está muy contenta por esta ayuda, ya que le permitirá estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Patricia is from the city of Ybycui.  She’s a person who is striving very much in order to become a professional in future and feel useful.  She comments that she lives in her parents’ house and in the morning does her apprenticeship at the city hospital and in the afternoons attends classes at university.  She’s studying Biochemistry and wants in future to use her skills to help in some hospital or other.  She requests this loan to pay for her university tuition fees so she can be rid of this expense and fully concentrate on her studies.  She’s very happy for the help because it will help her get closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Elba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elba, de 54 años vive en la ciudad de Managua, es madre de tres mayores de edad, ella se dedica atender una farmacia y ofrece servicios de enfermera pues anteriormente trabajaba en un puesto de salud pero al cumplir 39 años de edad empezó con su negocio de farmacia junto con uno de sus hijos y además una doctora que llega dos veces por semana hacer exámenes de rutina. Ella desea surtir más su farmacia para tener variedad de medicamentos que le solicitan sus clientes y un laboratorio  con todos los instrumentos. 
Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar una máquina de ultrasonido  y medicamentos para la farmacia. Esto le permitirá tener medicamentos en inventario y realizar exámenes de control prenatal que antes no hacía  y que con la inversión lo podrá realizar.
texts.en:
Elba, 54, lives in the city of Managua.  She’s the mother of three adult children.  She has a pharmacy and also offers nursing services since she used to work at a health center but at the age of 39 started her pharmacy business with one of her children.  In addition, a female doctor comes by twice a week to do routine check-ups.  She wants to stock her pharmacy with a variety of medicines her customers request and equip the lab with all instruments.

She’s asking for a loan to buy an ultrasound machine and medicines for the pharmacy.  This will make it possible for her to have medicine in stock and to do prenatal exams that she’s been unable to do up to now; with this investment she will be able to do them.

loans.use: to buy an ultrasound machine and to buy medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Jhonel

texts.es:
Jhonel, de 23 años, está casado con Janeth, con quien tiene 02 hijos pequeños , juntos viven en su casa propia. Jhonel se dedica a sembrar hortalizas, además de algunos productos  como yuca y ají,por está razón él aprovecha la temporada de cada uno de estos productos ya que en sus 04 años de trabajo ha a aprendido que cada producto tiene su tiempo de siembra. Todas sus actividades las realiza junto a su esposa y todos sus productos son colocados en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad pero antes de iniciarse con está actividad trabajaba para otras personas y tenia ganancias muy bajas por esto decidió iniciar su propio negocio además cuenta con un mototaxi el cual le sirve para transportar sus productos. Este será su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con cu negocio razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. 
Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles comprará abono orgánico y semillas de hortalizas para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Jhonel, 23 years old, is married to Janeth, with whom he has two children. They live together in their own house. 

Jhonel makes his living growing vegetables, along with some other crops like cassava and chili. For this reason, he has learned the season of each of his crops. In his four years of work, he has learned that each crop has its time for planting. All of his work is completed together with his wife, and all of their products are sold in the different city markets. 

Before starting this activity, he worked for other people, and had very low income. Because of this, he decided to start his own business. He relies on a motorcycle taxi which allows him to transport his products. 

This will be his first loan with Kiva, and he feels very grateful for the financial support he is receiving to move forward with his business. For this, he promises to pay his debts on time. With the amount requested, 3500 soles, he will buy organic fertilizer and vegetable seeds for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en: Senia is a 32 year old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing bananas to earn a living. Senia has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, bush knives, gloves and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Senia will spend her profits to help her family and also pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy, fertilizer, a wheel barrow, shovels, bush knives, gloves and a rake.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en: Frida is a 24 year old married woman with 2 children. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Frida has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, bush knives, a rake, gloves and a mist blower. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Frida will spend her profits to develop her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheel barrow, bush knives, a rake, gloves and a mist blower.

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en: Mesepi is a 52 year old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Mesepi needs a loan to buy sausages, chicken, mutton flaps, soy sauce and onions. She plans to use her profits for her children's education and also to help her family. Mesepi has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy sausages, chicken, mutton flaps, soy sauce and onions.

loans.name: Maleta

texts.en: Maleta is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She would like to start a small business printing and selling clothes in her community. In order to do this, Maleta needs a loan to buy design boards, paint brushes, fabric, a new sewing machine, needles and thread. She hopes to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy design boards, paint  brushes, fabric, a new sewing machine, needles and thread.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, el proviene de una familia muy trabajadora, que siempre le han dado muy buena educación y ejemplo. Cuenta que su objetivo es ser un gran profesional el día de mañana, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de instrumentación quirúrgica.
Cuenta que al terminar su carrera quiere estudiar para poder ser doctor, ya que ese siempre ha sido su sueño.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, y también para comprarse útiles y equipamientos para sus clases de instrumentación.
texts.en: Víctor is from the city of Paraguarí.  He comes from a very hardworking family that’s always set a good example and given him a good education.  He relates that his objective is to become a great professional in future which is why he’s studying the career of Surgical Instrumentation.  He comments that when he finishes his career he wants to study Medicine which has always been his dream.  He’s requesting this loan to pay university tuition fees and also to buy school supplies and equipment for his instrumentation classes.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees and also to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es una persona trabajadora  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos desde hace 4 años.
Don Oscar vende en su comunidad y demás caseríos aledaños a esta. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cerdos que necesita para seguir desarrollando su negocio. 
Don Oscar  espera que el préstamo  le sirva de mucha ayuda y poder contar con los insumos necesarios para continuar con  su trabajo y que esto se vea reflejado con el aumento de sus ventas y ganar más ingresos que beneficien en su estilo de vida y en el de su familia.
Don Oscar  espera en un futuro que su negocio sea uno de los más conocidos de la comunidad y así seguir apoyando a su familia y a sus hijos para que terminen los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Oscar is a hardworking and responsible person. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras with his wife and 2 children. He has been in the business of buying and selling pigs for 4 years. 

He sells in his community and in neighboring villages. He is requesting the loan to buy pigs, which he needs to continue to grow his business. Oscar hopes that the loan will be of great help to him so that he will be able to have the necessary inputs to continue his work and that this will be reflected in an increase in sales and his making more income to benefit his and his family’s lifestyle. 

Oscar hopes that in the future his business will be one of the best known in his community, and in this way he will continue to support his family, and his children will finish their studies and become good people with better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ella es Gilma mujer de 57 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos su negocio consiste en la venta de enchiladas y la siembra de granos es decir se dedica a  la agricultura, desde hace ya 9 años tiene de estar en esa actividad, el crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de insumos para la siembra como semilla mejorada, fertilizantes, insecticidas, el alquiler del terreno, preparación de terreno, etc. Sadia tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas chiverías, Y Rosario tiene 44 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three entrepreneurial women. One of them is Gilma, 57, married, with two children. She sells enchiladas and grows different types of grain (i.e. she works in agriculture). She has been doing this for nine years.

Gilma will use the loan to buy supplies for her plantations, such as improved seeds, fertilizer and insecticides, to pay for the rent of the land, and to prepare the soil. Sadia, 31, sells snacks and beverages. Rosario, 44, sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, and to pay for the rent of the land and for preparing the soil.

loans.name: 3.8.304.1.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

Hà is 60 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.8.304.1.Thiệu Toán  solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
Her children are grown up so Hà supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hà has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Claribel mujer divorciada, de 34 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de gaseosas variadas y hace rifas de artículos electrodomésticos en su comunidad y en el mercado de Masaya desde hace varios años. el crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de gaseosas variadas de diferentes sabores como diferentes marcas, coca cola, Pepsi, bigcola etc. María tiene 50 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Lesther tiene 25 años y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas coca cola.
texts.en: This solidarity group has three members.  One of them is Claribel, a divorced 34-year-old woman who has sold soft-drinks of various brands and also raffles home appliances in her community and in the Masaya market for several years.  She will use the loan to buy assorted brands of soft-drinks like Coca-Cola, Pepsi, Big Cola, etc.  María, 50, sells fruit and vegetables and Lesther, 25, sells Coca-Cola.

loans.use: to buy various brands of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
A $1,200.00 loan is offered to Santina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and other items. She has been involving herself in business activities since 1989. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money everyday.

Running a business has made Santina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and other items.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 32 years old and married with 5 children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Analiza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.

Analiza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, de 60 años de  edad, está casado con María y es madre de sus hijos quienes ya son independientes.  Vive cómodamente en su casa propia. Víctor se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles por está razón cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en su hogar. Tiene más de 05  años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien atiende cuando el esta realizando otras actividades. 
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos, además de estar en casa con su esposa. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio y ampliarlo vendiendo bebidas de diferentes marcas y sabores. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva y está muy contento de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, harina, entre otros.
texts.en:
Victor, 60 years old, is married to María, who is the mother of his children who are now independent. He lives comfortably in his own house. He makes his living selling groceries, and relies on a store which is installed in his house. 

He has dedicated himself to this business for more than five years, and so far has relied on the support of his wife, who is attentive when he is doing other activities. He likes his business, as it earns him very good income, in addition to being home with his wife. Because of this, he has plans to continue growing his business and expand selling drinks from different brands and flavors. 

This will be his first loan with Kiva, and he is very happy to receive financial support which will allow him to continue forward with his business. With the requested amount, 3000 new soles, he will buy groceries such as rive, sugar, milk, flour, among others.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar and milk, among others.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is an industrious mother who supported her husband in generating income. She is 59 years old and is blessed with three children. Due to financial difficulty, she has engaged herself in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She planned to raise more pigs to sell, but she has does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. She believes that her loan will be granted in order to improve the business and make a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo formado por cuatro socias, María es una de ellas tiene 47 años de edad, soltera, tiene una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace dos años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, aceite,  papel higiénico, sal, huevo, pan simple, pan dulce, productos lácteos como leche en bolsa, cremas acida, mantequilla, mortadela, chorizo, carne de pollo, carne de res, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar, jabón de lavar trastos, champo, gelatinas, cremas para el pelo, queso, cuajadas, etc. Jeymy tiene 28 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, Sara María tiene 35 años y su negocio es de una pulpería en su domicilio y Leyla tiene 27 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos Avon y tiene una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en: This group consists of four members. María is one of them.  She’s 47-years-old, single and has had a grocery store at home for the last two years.  She will use the loan to buy grains like rice, oil, toilet paper, salt, eggs, plain bread, sweet bread, dairy products like bagged milk, sour cream and butter, mortadela [smoked Italian sausage], sausage, chicken, beef, bath soap, laundry soap, dish soap, shampoo, gelatin, hair cream, cheese, etc.  Jeymy, 28, sells used clothes, Sara María, 35, has a home-based grocery store and Leyla, 27, sells Avon cosmetics and also has a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ma. Racil

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Racil works hard to support her family.

She has a variety store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales. 

Ma. Racil is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her variety store.

Ma. Racil has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 24 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1200.00 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $800.00.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as baskets, thermoses, glass mats, etc. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 11 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy baskets, thermoses, glass mats, etc. for her kiosk.

loans.name: Arlete Isabel

texts.pt:
Arlete de 30 anos de idade, é solteira e tem 3 filhos com idade escolar. Ela é professora há mais de 4 anos. O seu horário de trabalho é das 06:30h às 13:10h e ensina duas turmas. Sustenta também a prima que vive com ela.
A Arlete é também vendedora ambulante. O empréstimo será aplicado na compra de carne de porco e de vaca para revender.
O seu sonho é concluir o seu curso superior de psicologia educacional. O seu principal desafio é construir uma mercearia no quintal da sua casa.
texts.en:
30-year-old Arlete is single and has three school-age children. She has been a teacher for over four years. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 1:10 p.m. and teaches two classes. She also supports her female cousin who lives with her.
In addition, Arlete is a street vendor. The loan will be used to purchase pork and beef for re-selling.
Her dream is to finish her college degree in educational psychology. Her main challenge is building a grocery store in the backyard of her house.

loans.use: to purchase pork and beef for re-selling.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. Her previous loan was a big help not just for her business, but even in her family's expenses, especially her children's education. She is in this business for four years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Alma hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She attends the fellowship* every week for the teachings, and sharing the word of God continues to enlighten and uplift her spirit. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more gallons of mineral water and she was able to generate more income. The loan also helped in the education of her children, as well as in their household expenditures. She is in this business for four years now and she continues to work for her family.

She would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs as well as their household expenditures. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norma dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She attends the weekly fellowship* meeting that allows her to give of her own share of God’s love and care in her life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en: Sarah Jane is 43 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sarah Jane is borrowing PHP 34,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Sarah Jane has been raising pigs for 21 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
