loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 37 years old, married with two children who are in school. As what you have seen in the picture Catalina together with her husband Irvin work hand-in-hand to progress their food vending business. 

Catalina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Catalina requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia es de la ciudad de Carapeguá ella es estudiante, y una persona con gran potencial, esta estudiando la carrera de instrumentación quirúrgica, con lo cual quiere poder ayudar en las operaciones a las personas. Cuenta que su familia la inspiro para lograr su meta, ya que le decían que estudiando iba ser alguien en la vida.
Ella solicita de ester crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, como así también para sus gastos de manutención. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que ella recibe.
texts.en: Leticia is from the city of Carapegua. She is a student, and a person with great potential. She is studying to be a surgical assistant so that she can help with operations on people. She says that her family inspired her to achieve her goal because they told her that by studying, she could make something of herself in life. She seeks this loan to be able to pay for her classes and her living expenses. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received.

loans.use: to pay for classes and living expenses.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es una persona muy emprendedora, su familia es muy trabajadora y luchadora, tiene otros dos hermanos, quienes están estudiando. El estudia y trabaja por cuenta propia, y dice que desea poder graduarse y trabajar en una buena empresa.
El está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, la cual es una carrera que le gusta mucho y con la cual quiere también poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de una notebook, la cual será una gran herramienta para este estudiante como material de apoyo.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a very enterprising person.  His family is very hardworking and struggles to improve.  He has two other siblings who are also in school.  He studies and works at his own business.  He says he wants to graduate and work at a good business.

He is studying systems analysis, which is a career that he likes very much.  He will be able to help his family with this career.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase a notebook computer, which will be a tool to study support material.

loans.use: to purchase a notebook computer to use as a study tool.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
Tem 28 anos de idade, é casada, vive na casa propria com 2 filhos. Uma delas tem 7 anos e estuda e a outra nao tem idade escolar. Sandra e negociante há mais de 5 anos e e frequenta o 1º ano no Instituto Superior de Tecnologias e Gestão.
	O dinheiro do emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de roupas como camisetes, fatos, bolsas e sapatos para revenda. Sandra nao possui estabelecimento por isso faz entregas directamente ao seus clientes e cobra os valores no final do mes.Sandra tem a esperanca de fazer crescer o seu negocio.
	Tem o principal desafio de comprar uma viatura para transportar os produtos como forma de reter os seus clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old and married. She lives with her two children in a house that she owns. One of her children is 7 years old and the other one is below school age. Sandra has been a merchant for over five years and also attends the first year of the Higher Institute of Technology and Management.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase garments such as shirts, suits, bags and shoes for re-selling. Sandra doesn't have a store, so she delivers the products directly to her customers and collects payments at the end of the month. She hopes to make her business grow.
The main challenge she faces is acquiring a vehicle to transport her merchandise as a way of retaining her customers.

loans.use: to purchase garments such as shirts, suits, bags and shoes for re-selling.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a coconut wine vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of five grown-up children. Victor has been in the coconut wine business for more than five years, now. Coconut wine, locally known as 'tuba,' can also be fermented into vinegar. This is the source of his income.

Victor is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine to sell. With this additional coconut wine, he will be able to improve his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en:
Neng, 58, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia.  She is married and has seven children.  For the last thirty-nine years, Neng has been farming rice, planting cassava and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 19,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Neng is just with VisionFund this loan cycle.  Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan.  As the leader, Neng wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees for plowing the field.  She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham Province, Chen is 45 years old and lives with her three children. Her two daughters are still in school, and the third is a farmer. To deal with the daily cost of living, she grows cassava on two hectares of farmland. She has had in this business for 25 years, earning about 38,000 KHR per day. 

This is Chen's first loan cycle as a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is applying for 2,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides for her farmland and to pay for labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes that she can get high crop yield from her farming, which will help her achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her farmland and pay labor fees for plowing the field.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 57, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ramiro, a vendor and a mother to her children. By the grace of God, Helen has managed to support her children's daily needs. At this time, she is working hard to sustain their everyday expenses.

Helen sells different silver and gold accessories like earrings, bracelets and rings. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a Php 25, 000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more silver and gold accessories.

Helen dreams of expanding her business and having her own stall. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and encouragement studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more silver and gold accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
As the owner of a dance studio that instructs over 200 students in over 130 different styles of dance, Laura is passionate about people from around the world, instilling in her students understanding and deep respect for each culture. Her motto is to “bring the world together by teaching different international cultural dances, thereby bringing people together and honoring their unique and special lives.”

Laura’s dance academy began from a life-long dream to teach the joy of life through dancing. Growing up in a family that owned a nationally recognized square dance apparel company, Laura’s childhood was filled with dancing and colorful costumes. Her training began in a French ballet school, and she eventually graduated from the Georgia Copeland Studio. She spent the following years touring the world as a professional dancer, until she felt drawn back to her hometown of San Diego to open her first dance studio at 23.

Today, Laura’s studio, The Academy of World Dance N Arts, has evolved and expanded to its current location. She now employs two other dance instructors to provide her diverse range of classes. Laura prides herself in having the most affordable dance classes in the San Diego region to ensure that price is never a barrier for people who love to dance. She shares that her passion is to inspire people to follow their dreams, and that she loves to pass along the traditions and dances that may otherwise become lost.  

This loan from Kiva will enable Laura to purchase a sewing machine that can withstand the numerous costumes she hand-makes for her students. Her loan will also be used to purchase a new music system, gymnastics mats, and new copier and printer machines. 

Laura’s dream is to open an additional studio space to open up the program to more teachers and instructors. With your help, Laura can continue to share the cultures of the world with her young dance students.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to make costumes, and also new studio equipment

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to buy more gasoline to sell.

Amy has been in this business for two years. Amy earns additional income from rice retailing.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Angeles has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Angeles would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Sarou,  50, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey District of Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice and plant sesame as the main sources of her family’s income; they have been in this business for ten years. The current business earns her about 47,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.

Sarou has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely paid back her past loans, which have helped relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland; she will also use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 45 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Juan se dedica a la venta de discos compactos que contienen música cristiana, además de biblias y pequeños instrumentos musicales en puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Anteriormente realizaba sus ventas como ambulante  y con las ganancias que fue obteniendo puso su pequeño negocio en su casa el cual está a cargo su esposa y para obtener mejores ingresos puso su puesto en el mercado. Lleva en esta actividad un promedio de 7 años y este trabajo le permite difundir la religión cristiana en su localidad a través de la música, entre sus principales clientes están sus compañeros del grupo religioso en el que participa y otras personas que gustan de este género. Espera seguir trabajando con la motivación que lo caracteriza y junto a su esposa ampliar su negocio con mayor mercadería y variedad de productos que suele comercializar. Gracias a las ganancias que obtiene puede ayudar económicamente a sus hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando afuera de su localidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con el apoyo financiero necesario para seguir adelante con su negocio. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar más discos de música y vídeo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children who live with him in his adobe house. Juan makes a living by selling CDs of Christian music, as well as bibles and small musical instruments at his post in his community's market. Previously, he sold his merchandise on foot and, with the profits that he obtained, he moved his small business to his home, which his wife is in charge of. To obtain more income, he established his post in the market.

He currently has about 7 years of experience in this business and this work permits him to spread Christianity in his community through music. Among his main clients are those in the religious group in which he participates and other people who like this genre.

He hopes to continue working with his characteristic motivation and, along with his wife, expand his business with more merchandise and a greater variety of products that he always sells. Thanks to the money that he has been able to earn, he can financially help his children, who are studying outside of the community. 

This is his second loan through Kiva, and he hopes to obtain the financial support necessary to continue forward with his business. On this occasion, he seeks 3,000 nuevos soles in order to buy more music and video discs for his clients.

loans.use: to buy Christian music discs.

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en:
Youn is 37 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and has five children, two of whom are still in school. She has farmed rice and sesame for 10 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day. Her husband supplements their income by working as a carpenter in a village. 

Youn’s group consists of four members who are all female. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has used the past loans successfully to better support her family. Now Youn is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and pay labor costs. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is 54 years old and married. She rents out printers and photocopiers to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to build a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and is now applying for her second loan of $1,200. Emelia will buy additional supplies such as photocopiers, printers, printer ink, and other items. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy photocopiers, printers, printer ink, and other items.

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thol is a 43-year-old mother of six children. Three of them are dependents and still in school. Rice farming has been the only source of income for her family for the past ten years. To earn more income Thol has been working as a paid worker. Her current business brings in about 22,000 KHR per day.

Thol has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Thol is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get more income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Beliz

texts.pt:
É casado, vive na casa própria e tem duas filhas, uma com 5 anos e outra com 1 mes.
É negociante há mais de 5 anos, praticando o seu negócio no Distrito da Manhiça (Provincia de Maputo) no seu estabelecimento e vende quase todo o dia. O dinheiro do emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de produtos como arroz, refrescos, cerveja, massas, farinhas e outros tipos de produtos comestiveis.
Beliz tem a esperanca de progredir com o seu negocio para a frente. É também de salientar que tem uma escolinha em sua casa, onde a sua esposa dá aulas. Devido ao sucesso desta escolinha, Beliz gostava de comprar mais equipamentos para esta escolinha. Os principais desafios é comprar mais bens de consumo, isto é, adiquirir mais mobilia para sua casa porque acaba de  concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Beliz is married. He lives in a house that he owns and he has two daughters. One of his daughters is 5 years old and the other is 1-month-old.
He has been a merchant for over five years. He does business in his store located in the district of Manhiça (province of Maputo) and sells almost throughout the day. The money from the loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as rice, refreshments, beer, noodles, flour and other kinds of foodstuffs.
Beliz is hopeful that he'll make progress in his business from now on. It also should be noted that he runs a preschool from his home where his wife teaches. Because this preschool is so successful, Beliz would like to buy more equipment for the school. His main challenge is buying more consumer goods, that is to say, buying more furniture for his house, since he just finished doing construction work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, refreshments, beer, noodles, flour and other kinds of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
This is Leonila, 55, resident of Payatas. Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alvino, a construction worker. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leonila raises poultry and then sells them. She also sells poultry supplies like Purina 3, Galfmanag, bird seeds, craca corn and other items. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 250 in sales every day.

She is now requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of poultry supplies.

Leonila hopes to expand her business and dreams of having good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. While there she draws strength and inspiration studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of poultry supplies.

loans.name: Adélia

texts.pt:
Adélia tem 2 filhos que andam na 7ª e 11ª classes e têm 11 e 16 anos respectivamente. É casada, vive na casa própria e ajuda a sua mãe dando dinheiro mensalmente. É trabalhadora numa empresa de fabrico de produtos alimentares como embaladora há mais de 3 anos. 
	A Adélia tem um negócio de criação de frangos em sua casa. O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de pintos, ração e vitaminas para utilizar no seu negócio. Ela sonha em pedir mais empréstimos para continuar com a criação de frangos e para montar um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa onda possa vender mais produtos.
texts.en:
Adélia has two children who attend 7th and 11th grade and are 11 and 16 years old respectively. She's married and lives in a house that she owns. She helps her mother by sending her money on a monthly basis. For more than three years she has worked as a packager for a food production company.
Adélia owns a business breeding chickens in her house. The money from the loan will be used to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for using in her business. She dreams of applying for more loans in order to keep her chicken breeding business going, and also to set up a store in her home where she can sell more products.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for using in her chicken breeding business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia.  She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.  Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result more profits.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to have good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.es:
John tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres en la ciudad Curuguaty.  Actualmente está cursando el 5to año de Derecho en una de las mejores universidades. Es funcionario nombrado de la Corte Suprema de Justicia desempeñando el cargo de Ujier notificador.
El cuenta que quiere ser un gran abogado para poder ayudar a las demás personas que necesiten de su ayuda, es por eso que se está esforzando para Salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y también para comprar útiles para usar en su universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
John is 23-years-old and lives with his parents in the city of Curaguaty. Currently, he is in his 5th year of law school in one of the best universities. He is a renowned civil servant of the Justice of the Supreme Court performing the job of a court clerk.  

He describes that he wants to be a big lawyer so that he can help other people that are in need of help. For this reason, he is working hard to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to invest in tuition and also to for items that he will use in the university. He is grateful for the opportunity that he has received because this will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay tuition and purchase items for the university

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is married and has 4 children. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital. 

She is taking a loan of $600 from TRM(Tuba Rai Metin). She feels better than when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin is 46 years old and married.  She has three children, all of whom are dependent on the family and they are now still in school.  Living in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Sarin grows rice and cassava while her husband works as a paid worker.  Having been in business for twenty-eight years, she manages to earn about US$ 10. 

This is the first loan for Sarin with VisionFund.  Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Saren, 29, is single and lives in a village of the Dambae district, Kampong Cham.  To make a living, he has been growing cassava for ten years and the current business earns him about 22,000 KHR per day.  Low crop yields is the main challenge for his business.

Saren has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle.  He fully paid back the past loan.  The past loan helped him better support his family.  Now he is leading his group to ask for another loan.  As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy pesticides for his farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor fees.  He hopes to increase his family’s income from his current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
A senhora Albertina é casada e tem 5 filhos mas vive apenas com 4 filhos que vão à escola.
	Ela vende ovos, que entrega em casa dos seus clientes. Além disso, ela vende também produtos alimentares num estabelecimento em sua casa.	O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos alimentares como farinha, ovos, refrescos, cerveja, bolachas e outros.
	Albertina diz que tem como sonho comprar uma viatura para usar no seu negócio e para isso planeia pedir mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Albertina is married and has five children, but only lives with four of them who attend school.
She sells eggs, which she delivers to her customers' homes. In addition, she also sells foodstuffs in a store located in her house. The money from the loan will be used to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, eggs, refreshments, beer, crackers, etc.
Albertina states that her dream is to acquire a vehicle to use in her business, and for that purpose she plans to apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, eggs, refreshments, beer and crackers for selling in her store.

loans.name: Eri

texts.es:
Eri tiene 21 años de edad vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Curuguaty, el mismo proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora su madre es comerciante y su padre agricultor.
Actualmente trabaja como secretario una empresa donde piensa ocupar el cargo mas alto algún día, Comenta que para eso se esmera en sus estudio, ya que esta cursando la carrera de  Administración de Empresas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar cuotas y también para la compra de materiales que pueda servirle para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eri is 21-years-old and lives with his parents in the city of Curuguaty. He comes from a humble and hard working family. His mother is a merchant and his father is a farmer. 

Currently, he works as a secretary in a business where he expects to work at the highest-level one day. He comments that this is the reason he applies himself to his studies, because he is studying with a Business Administration major. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in tuition and to purchase materials that he can use for his studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and purchase materials for his studies

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
É casado, vive na casa própria, é pai de 8 filhos que vão à escola (7ª, 9ª, 10ª classes e os 2 últimos na 2ª classe). É trabalhador do Ministério da Saúde afecto no hospital Central do Maputo.
	Os fundos do empréstimo serão aplicados na compra de material de construção: cimento, areia, pedra e varões, para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
	As suas esperanças para o seu futuro profissional e pessoal são de finalizar a sua obra e adquirir a mobília para a sua casa.
texts.en:
Alberto is married and lives in a house that he owns. He has eight children who attend school (7th, 9th and 10th grades, and the last two are in 2nd grade). He works for the Ministry of Health and he's assigned to the Maputo Central Hospital.
The funds from the loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks and rods) in order to continue building his house.
His hopes for his personal and professional future are to finish the construction work and acquire furniture for his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, rocks and rods) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah.  She previously accessed a 31,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed for her business.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 34,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feed needed in her business.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sarah hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to have her own house.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and encouragement from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional hogs and feed needed in her business.

loans.name: Pantaleon

texts.en:
Pantaleon is a 49 year old married man from Talibon,Bohol.  He has 2 young children ages 6 and 8 respectively.  He is engaged in farming.  He grows rice which serves as his means of making a living. 

He has been growing rice for more than 5 years now.  He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and medicine to improve his harvest and also to gain more income.  In the future, Pantaleon would like to improve his farming livelihood and to be able to have a sustainable livelihood and provide his children with the best that he can.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng, 52, lives with her husband and nine children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. All of her nine children, two of whom are dependents, are still in school. To feed the family, Heng and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice for thirteen years, earning about 19,000 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs.

Heng has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her support her family as well as her children's education. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Heng wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and widowed with three children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Arlyn borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years.

Arlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
A loan of $4,800 helps Manuel to purchase additional inventory, establish a commercial relationship with Accion East and Online, and further develop his credit.

Manuel is originally from the Dominican Republic. He has been living in the United States for five years with his wife and children. Part of his motivation for starting his own business developed from his desire to be more independent and to raise capital to improve the quality of life for his family. Manuel believes that “there is nothing better than being self-employed”. Since September 2012, he has owned and operated DMMJ Grocery, a bodega that sells groceries, deli meats/sandwiches, and general store items. Part of his success is due to his extensive experience running a bodega in the Dominican Republic. Manuel is driven to continue building his credit and developing his skills as an entrepreneur while simultaneously seeking to meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and build credit

loans.name: Baby Girl

texts.en:
Baby Girl was only 26 years old in 2011 when she was last listed on Kiva. Now she is 28 years old and single.

Baby Girl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store like milk, coffee, eggs, laundry soap, bath soap and other groceries.

Baby Girl has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from an eatery.

She successfully paid back her previous loan on Kiva and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Baby Girl aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, like milk, coffee, eggs, laundry soap, bath soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Wossidji I Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe WOSSIDJI I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Warinibougou, un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le mil, et d’arachide en association avec le gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, GNEBA  deuxième  personne  à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2Ha de mil et d’arachide en association avec le gombo
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000F CFA environs pendant cette  campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "WOSSIDJI I" are married women averaging 41 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Warinibougou, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include millet and peanuts along with okra. They are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, GNEBA, who is the second person sitting from the right, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain about 2 hectares of millet and peanuts along with okra.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in Fana City. She plans on making a profit of about 200,000 francs CFA for this planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una señora soltera de 57 años de edad quien tiene 3 hijas quienes viven en el Caserío Pasac, Aldea Xejuyup Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración y venta de prendas típicas las cuales son, paños y güipiles típicos que se utilizan en el lugar donde vive. Esta actividad lo realiza desde su vivienda, de esta manera obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables para el sustento familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de paños y güipiles típicos y con ello ofrecerles  más variedades de prendas, a sus clientes y de  esta manera obtener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor producto y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is a 57-year-old single woman. She has 3 daughters who live with her in the neighborhood of Pasac, in the village of Xejuyup Nahualá, in the department of Sololá. For the past 10 years she has made her living making and selling traditional clothing such as paños [traditional wraps] and güipiles [traditional indigenous blouses] clothing that is commonly worn in the region where she lives. She does this business from her home, which helps her earn enough income and profits to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan of Q 2,000.00 to purchase the raw materials for the production of traditional paños and güipiles and will be able to offer a greater variety of clothing to her customers and thus obtain better profits. Her dream is to expand her business to offer her customers a better product and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the production of traditional clothing

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un señor casado de 43 años quien tiene 4 hijos, 1 hombre y 3 mujeres quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica desde hace 20 años  a la compraventa de productos artesanales, como chalinas y pulseras. Eligio esta actividad ya que obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables mediante lo que comercializa en su comunidad. Es de esta manera como contribuye a la economía familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 que utilizará para compra de hilo para la elaboración de chalinas y pulseras que actualmente comercializa.
Su mayor sueño es apoyar a sus hijos,  para que puedan culminar sus estudios y así tener  mejores oportunidades en el campo laboral.
texts.en:
Antonio, 43, is a married man who has four children, one male and three females who live in Sololá.

He has made a living for 20 years buying and selling handcrafted products such as scarves and bracelets.  He chose this job because he earns an acceptable income and profits with what he sells in his community.  This way he contributes to the family budget.

He's requesting a loan for 8,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy thread to make and sell scarves and bracelets.

His biggest dreams is to get his children ahead so they can finish their studies and have better job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase thread to make scarves and bracelets

loans.name: Aracili

texts.en:
Aracili is 51 years old and single.

Aracili is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Aracili requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aracili has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aracili would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Allakabon  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Allakabon IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Sinsinsa Kinisso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec setou, 2 ème debout de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits materiels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à  Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Allakabon IV" are married women averaging 39 years of age and seven children each, all living in traditional families in Sinsinsa Kinisso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work for the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop crown is peanuts, as is the case with Setou, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village of Koutiala. She plans on making a profit of 75,000 francs CFA at the end of planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and equipment

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 68 años de edad, esta casado y tiene seis hijos. Él es una persona trabajadora y muy emprendedora, desde que tenía 10 años se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos, esto lo aprendió gracias a su padre que siempre fue un agricultor y gracias a él hoy conoce mucho sobre las actividades que requiere un cultivo de maíz, también con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos se dedican a la elaboración de muñecos de barro los cuales elaboran desde hace 35 años.

 los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos  como lo son los fertilizantes  y paquete de herbicidas, fungicidas necesarios para la siembra los compra en un municipio y se tarda un tiempo de 15 minutos en carro desde la comunidad donde vive,  y los materiales para la elaboración de muñecos de barro los obtienen  en distintas comunidades del departamento donde se extrae el barro; lo cual en ocasiones dificulta  el proceso por las distancias que recorren para trasladar el material, aunque siempre se obtiene en abundancia para realizar el proceso. 



El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  4 quintales de abono, 1 bolsa de semilla de maíz y fungicidas para el control de plagas y la otra parte para la obtención de materia prima para la elaboración de muñecos de barro e incluso la compra de producto ya elaborado por otros artesanos ya que la demanda de productos es alta. 

Con el apoyo brindado al cliente podrá comprar los abonos necesarios para sacar adelante el cultivo  de  7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que ha establecido con el fin de generar algún excedente para la venta de maíz, y  se estará fortaleciendo el negocio de elaboración de muñecos de barro; ya que el cliente  y su familia  tienen tres puntos de ventas  uno  en Ilobasco a  15 minutos de su casa,  otro en la ciudad de san Vicente a 1 hora de su casa  y en Sensuntepeque  a  30 minutos de su casa, con esto podrán abastecer de mejor manera la demanda en los tres puntos de venta. 

Con este préstamo el cliente tendrá oportunidad de cultivar los granos básicos que serían asegurando la alimentación de su grupo familiar y  además con el préstamo comprara más materia prima para  elaborar mayor cantidad de muñecos de barro para abastecer los distintos puntos de venta  que tiene y así poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia.

Entre sus planes esta aperturar más puntos de ventas,  ya que con el apoyo crediticio cuenta con capital de inversión para  materias primas  y así abastecer la demanda del mercado.
texts.en:
Rafael is 68-years-old, is married and has six children. He is a very hardworking and enterprising person, since he was 10 years has been dedicated to the production of basic grains. He learned this from his father who was always a farmer and thanks to him, today he knows a lot about the farming activities required to harvest corn. Also with the help of his wife and children, he creates clay dolls, which he has done for 35 years.  

The agricultural supplies he needs to harvest basic grains include fertilizers, herbicides package, and fungicides. He needs the items for planting. He buys the items in municipality. This takes him 15 minutes by car from the community where he lives. Also, he gets the materials for the making clay dolls from different communities of the department where the clay is removed. This sometimes hinders the process due to the distance he covers to transfer the material. However he always gets an abundance to complete the process.

The loan he is requesting from Field Foundation will be used to buy 4 pounds of manure, 1 bag of corn seeds, and fungicides for pest control. The other part will be used to obtain raw material for the production of clay dolls. Also he will purchase already developed products by other artisans because demand is high.

With the support provided to the customer, he will be able to purchase the fertilizer needed to proceed with the cultivation of 7,000 square meters of corn, which he established to generate a surplus of corn to sell. Also he will strengthen the business making clay dolls. The client and his family have three stores, one in Ilobasco that is 15 minutes from his house, one in the city of San Vicente that is 1 hour, and Sensuntepeque that is 30 minutes from his house. This allows him to better supply the demand with the three locations of sales.

With this loan, the customer will have the opportunity to grow basic grains that would ensure food of your household. Also, with the loan he can buy more raw materials to produce a greater quantity of clay dolls to supply the various stores. This way he can generate more income for his family.

He plans include opening more stores. The loan supports his investment capital for raw materials to supply the market demand.

loans.use: to buy 4 pounds of manure, 1 bag of corn seeds, and fungicides for pest control. The other part will be used to obtain raw material for the production of clay dolls. Also he will purchase already developed products by other artisans because demand is high.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is taking out a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $100.  

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín es un señor casado de 36 años de edad quien tiene 4 hijos, 2 hombres y 2 mujeres quienes viven en el Caserío Central 1 Aldea Chuiquel,  Sololá, Sololá. 
El actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda, la cual le genera ingresos y ganancias aceptables para su familia. Inicio esta actividad hace 1 año, viendo la necesidad de su familia y la de sus vecinos de tener una tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad. 
El está  solicitando un préstamo de Q  7,000.00 para comprar más productos y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, de este modo el puede brindarles un  mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es darle  estudio  a sus hijos para que se preparen para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Martín is a 36-year-old married man. He has four children, two boys and two girls. They live in the small central village of Chuiquel, Sololá, Sololá.

He currently has a grocery store in his home, which earns adequate income for his family. He started this business one year ago, seeing his family's need, and that of his neighbors to have a grocery store in the community.

He is requesting a loan of 7,000.00 Q to buy more products and expand his grocery store. This will allow him to provide better service to his customers and earn more income.

His dream is to send his children to school to prepare them for a better future.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer casada de 39 años de edad,  tiene 2 hijas de 9 y 6 años,  actualmente viven en el Callejón San Francisco del Municipio de Panajachel del departamento de Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos de vestir como sandalias entre otros.  Por la falta de oportunidades de empleo decidió aprender este oficio para poder sufragar los gastos familiares. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 11,000.00 para la compra de materiales como suelas, cuero y  plantillas para poder elaborar diferentes zapatos. 
Su sueño es tener un local en donde pueda colocar sus zapatos  y así ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, de esta manera podrá generar mejores ganancias para poder construir su casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a 39-year-old woman. She has 2 daughters that are 9 and 6 years old. Currently she lives in Callejón San Francisco ,of the municipality of Panajachel, in the department of Sololá. 

She works in the sale of dress shoes such as sandals and other items. Due to lack of employment opportunities, she decided to learn this skill to pay the family household expenses.  Because of her work she is able to generate an acceptable income and earnings.

She is requesting a loan of 11,000,000 GTQ to purchase materials such as soles, leather, and insoles to create different shoes. Her dream is to have a store where she can find her shoes and provide better service to her customers. This way she will be able to earn more income to build a house and have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to create shoes

loans.name: Allakabon  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Allakabon  III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Sinsinsa Kinisso, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide et le mil avec Batou, 2 ème debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits materiels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 135.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Allakabon III" are married women averaging 31 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Sinsinsa Kinisso, a village in Koutiala (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work for the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crops crown are peanuts and millet, as is the case with Batou, who is the second person standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 2 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village of Koutiala. She plans on making a profit of 135,000 francs CFA at the end of planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and equipment

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a food production and vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Catalina has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 59 años de edad, es padre de un hijo. Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura  y a la  ganadería desde muy corta edad (9 años) ya que la siembra de granos básicos  y la crianza de ganado lechero fue lo que su padre le enseño como herramienta para salir adelante en la  vida, 

Los insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos y el concentrado para ganado lechero los compra en el municipio ubicado a 20 minutos de la comunidad donde vive, aunque prepara silos para la alimentación de ganado  y las materia primas las obtiene cultivando los pastos  y la compra de algunos residuos de la cosecha a agricultores de la zona donde vive. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 vacas lecheras; con el fin de incrementar el número de animales que posee e incrementar la producción de leche para comercializarla.  Al obtener mayor cantidad de leche puede diversificarse  y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a nuevos clientes, teniendo mayor oportunidad de crecimiento en su negocio de venta de leche  y otros derivados, para llevar el sustento a su familia, su madre  y  su hijo. Él tiene como objetivo principal, incrementar el número de animales que maneja actualmente  con el fin de poder generar mas oportunidades de negocios para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jesus, 59 years old, is the father of one child. He has worked as a farmer in agriculture and ranching since he was 9 years old. His father taught him how to sow basic grains and raise cows for milk as a tool to move forward in life.

He buys cow feed and agricultural supplies for sowing basic grains in a town 20 minutes from the community where he lives, although he also has silos for the cow feed and he gets basic materials by cultivating the pastures. He buys some remaining items for harvesting from farmers in the area where he works.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy 2 cows for milk in order to increase the number of his animals and increase milk production to sell. Once he has more milk, he can diversify and offer better quality products to new customers, giving him a better opportunity to grow his business of selling milk and similar products. This will allow him to provide for his family, his mother, and his child. His main goal is to increase the number of animals he has so he will have more opportunities to move forward.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows for milk

loans.name: Maria Telesfora

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a su madre y tres de sus hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado  a la agricultura al cultivo de café y granos básicos. También ha realizado actividades en alfarerías donde hacen productos de barro.
Esta actividad agrícola ha sido su fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Y para mantenerla activa Ha solicitado un cuarto préstamo a ODEF para comprar abonos  e insecticidas y poder abonar y  fumigar la parcela de café para poder sacar mejor producción. Ella tiene como plan seguir mejorando sus cultivos para mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Maria is 54-years-old. She is a single mother with 5 children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira with her mother and her children. Her entire life she has been dedicated to agriculture and the cultivation of coffee and basic grains.  She has also created clay pottery. 

Her agricultural activities have been the source income that supports her family. In order to keep it active, she is requesting a loan from ODEF to purchase manure and insecticides. This way she can fertilize and fumigate her plot of coffee crops in order to have a better yield.   Her plan is to continue improving the quality of her crops and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and insecticides to fumigate her plot of land with coffee crops.

loans.name: Bequer

texts.es: Bequer, de 22 años es un joven independiente. Vive en una casa alquilada pero cada mes visita a su mamá y a su familia. Comenzó desarrollando su principal objetivo. Estudiar diseño gráfico publicitario en la capital. Hace 6 años comenzó a trabajar en una fábrica textil, ahí aprendió todo lo necesario en este rubro y a su corta edad tienen muchos proyectos y objetivos. En este corto tiempo aprendió todo lo necesario para el mantenimiento de maquinarias pesadas, esto le ayudo a ganar un poco más de dinero, ya que en sus tiempos libres ofrece este servicio a diferentes fábricas de la capital. Ahora comenzó a abrir su propia fábrica de ropas, ya tienen una máquina de costura recta y muy pronto comprará más maquinarias para poder implementar su pequeño taller. Por el momento realiza polos de todo tamaño y estilo. “El camino es largo”, afirma con optimismo. Pero sabe que con trabajo y esfuerzo lo logrará. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA y está seguro de poder concretar sus objetivos. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Bequer; invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de una máquina remalladota industrial, que mejorará el tiempo de confección de los polos que elabora.
texts.en: Bequer is 22 years old. He is an independent young man. He lives in a rented house but every month he visits his mother and his family. He started developing his main goal by studying graphic design for advertising. Six years ago, he started working in a textile factory. There he learned everything he needed in that area and at his young age he has a lot of projects and goals.In that short time he learned everything he needed to know about maintenance of heavy machinery. This helped him to earn a little more money, since in his free time he offers this service to different factories in the capital. Now he has started to open his own clothing factory. They already have a straight sewing machine and very soon, he will buy more machines to outfit his little workshop. For now, he makes all types and sizes of shirts. “It's a long rode”, he says, with optimism. But he knows that with hard work and dedication he will achieve it. This is his second Kiva loan and he is sure that he can meet his goals. That is why he promises to make his payments on time. Bequer will invest the S/.1000 soles in buying an industrial overlock machine. This will improve his sewing time for the shorts he makes.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine.

loans.name: Wossidji Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe WOSSIDJI III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Warinibougou, un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,   préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le  mil, et d’arachide en association avec le gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TATA  deuxième  personne  à  gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1Ha de mil et d’arachide en association avec le gombo
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100 000F CFA environs pendant cette  campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "WOSSIDJI III" are married women averaging 35 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Warinibougou, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include millet and peanuts along with okra. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, TATA, who is the second person sitting from the left, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare of millet, peanuts, and okra. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in to men and women customers in Fana City. She plans on making a profit of about 100,000 francs CFA for this planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Wossidji  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe WOSSIDJI IV sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Warinibougou, un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  du mil, et d’arachide en association avec le gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TANKOUROU première  personne  à  gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0.75Ha de mil et d’arachide en association avec le gombo
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de la ville de fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60 000F CFA environs pendant cette  campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "WOSSIDJI IV" are married women averaging 34 years of age and four children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Warinibougou, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include millet and peanuts along with okra. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, TANKOUROU, who is the first person sitting from the left, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain ¾ hectare of millet, peanuts, and okra. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in to men and women customers in Fana City. She plans on making a profit of about 60,000 francs CFA for this planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Wossidji Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe WOSSIDJI II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Warinibougou, un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka   préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le mil, et d’arachide en association avec le gombo. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, BINTOU la personne  au milieu dans le rang des debout compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2Ha de mil et d’arachide en association avec le gombo
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 175 000 CFA environs pendant cette campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group "WOSSIDJI II" are married women averaging 38 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Warinibougou, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include millet and peanuts along with okra. The women are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, BINTOU, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain 2 hectares of millet, peanuts, and okra. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in to men and women customers in Fana City. She plans on making a profit of about 175,000 francs CFA for this planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Kiara

texts.es: Kiara de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía y de helados en un punto comercial que ha surtido poco a poco, desde hace 2 años. Ella habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas de 5 años y de 11 meses,  en una urbanización ubicada a la orilla del mar. Sus principales productos de la oferta son papelería, ropa, heladería y accesorios, artículos que empezó vendiendo entre sus amistades y que inicialmente compró con dinero que adquirió, cuando decidió retirarse de su trabajo, y dedicarse a la actividad comercial en un punto fijo, ubicado en su propio domicilio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus compras las hacen de contado, en puntos especializados en el centro de la ciudad, donde le ofrecen buenos precios y puede acceder a promociones.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, prime financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, papelería, accesorios femeninos y productos de heladería, artículos que son los de mayor rotación y que hacen de su credikiva una inversión muy exitosa. Su meta es aumentar la oferta de crédito a los clientes excelentes y apoyar el desarrollo y bienestar de sus hijas, para que tengan un potencial importante de éxito futuro, mediante el incremento de sus ingresos y con   la aplicación de toda su fuerza de trabajo   dirigida a este fin.
texts.en:
Kiara is 24-years-old. She has worked in the sale of merchandise and ice cream in a commercial store that she has supplied little by little for the past 2 years. She lives with her husband and her two daughters (5 years old and 11 months) in a housing development near the shore. Her main products include paper, clothes, ice cream, and accessories. She started selling her articles to friends with money that she acquired when she left her job to work in a commercial point located in her own home.  She completes her sales through cash and credit. She works every day from 8 in the morning to 8 at night.  Her cash purchases are completed through locations in the center of the city, where she offers good prices and is able to offer promotions. 

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase clothing, paper, feminine accessories and ice cream products. She chose the articles that are the most popular so that she can have a great returned on from her investment of the Kiva credit. Her goal is to increase her offering of credit to her excellent clients and help the development and well being of her daughters. She wants them to be successful in the future. Through the increase in income and with her hard work she will direct the outcome to her goal.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, paper, accessories, and ice cream products

loans.name: Helen Patricia

texts.es:
Helen tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos. vive con sus 3 hijos entre las edades de 4 a 5 años, es una señora muy emprendedora. Tiene una visión clara de lo que quiere, actualmente se dedica al corte y confección de telas con una experiencia de 2 años, ademas vende charamuscas, paletas y gelatinas desde hace 9 años oficio que lo aprendió de su mamá. El esposo trabaja en sus tiempos libres en agricultura, actividad de donde produce los granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia.

Los materiales que utiliza para corte y confección como: telas, hilos, agujas, botones ziper los compra en un municipio, debe de salir de mañana de su casa para abordar el autobús que tarda 20 minutos. También compra productos como azúcar, palillos frutas para una venta de gelatinas, paletas y charamuscas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  2 sacos de abono, 5 litros de herbicida, 1 libra de insecticidas para el gusano para cultivar 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz; la otra parte la destinara para comprar telas, agujas, hilos, ziper, frutas, azúcar y palillos estos para mejorar su negocio que tiene desde hace varios años.

     Tendrá una mejor alimentación para su familia; porque generara mas ingresos y se le apoyara para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así pueda trabajar la agricultura y obtener los granos para la alimentación de sus hijos.


       Helen piensa solicitar un crédito a futuro, para instalar una tienda mas surtida de productos como golosinas, bebidas refrescantes y productos de primera necesidad. También piensa comprar otra maquina de cocer para generar mas ingresos y poder dar un estudio superior a sus hijos y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Helen is 39 and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 5. She is an enterprising woman and has a clear vision of what she wants. She works in dressmaking and has done so for two years. In addition, she sells candy twists, popsicles, and jelly. She learned this work from her mother and has done so for 9 years. In his free time, her husband grows the basic grains to feed the family. 

The materials that she uses for dressmaking are fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and zippers. She purchases these things in the municipality. She needs to leave in the morning from her house to board the bus that takes 20 minutes. She also purchases products such as sugar, fruit skewers for selling the jelly, popsicles, and candy twists. 

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer, 5 liters of herbicide, and 1 pound of worm insecticide to cultivate 3,500 square meters of corn. The other part of the loan is to purchase fabric, needles, thread, zippers, fruits, sugar, and skewers. These are to improve her business that she has had for several years. 

With the loan, she will be able to offer more nourishing food for her family because she can earn a better income, and with the agricultural supplies, she will be able to farm the grains she needs to feed her children. 

Helen is thinking about requesting another loan in the future to make a better stocked store with products such as sweets, refreshments, and essential goods. She is also considering purchasing another sewing machine to be able to earn more income and offer a top notch education to her children, thus improving her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: purchase 2 bags of fertilizer, 5 liters of herbicide, and 1 pound of worm insecticide to cultivate 3,500 square meters of corn. The other part of the loan is to purchase fabric, needles, thread, zippers, fruits, sugar, and skewers for her other businesses.

loans.name: Dinora Noemy

texts.es:
Dinora tiene 28 años de edad, esta acompañada, tiene un hijo y en espera de  un segundo hijo ya le faltan 2 meses para dar a luz. Actualmente, es ama de casa desde hace 6 años y lo aprendió de su mamá,  tiempo atrás trabajó de vendedora en una tienda por 5 años, pero cuando decidió acompañarse ya no pudo seguir trabajando, por el rol de madre que le toco desempeñar en su hogar. Ella no hace ninguna actividad productiva por el estado de embarazo en que se encuentra , pero su compañero de vida cultiva 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y también trabaja en albañilería. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 bolsas de cemento, 2 quintales de hierro y laminas para terminar de colocar el techo de la vivienda que esta siendo construida.

Con el crédito se estará apoyando al cliente, para que pueda comprar sus materiales para concluir la construcción de su vivienda ya que la tiene en proceso de construcción y necesita terminarla por las lluvias que ya han iniciado y poder tener un lugar seguro para su hijo y el que esta en camino.

   Dinora por el momento esta viviendo con su mamá, pero cuando construya su casa tendrá una vivienda digna  y sera una familia unida e independiente con mejores condiciones de vida para sus hijos.

En un futuro no muy lejano, después de tener a su segundo hijo, ella tiene planeado salir a vender productos de belleza por catalogo, para tener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia y así poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y poder salir con las cuotas del crédito que adquirieron para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dinora is 28 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has a son and a second child on the way that is due in 2 months. She has been a housewife for the past 6 years and learned this from her mother. In the past she worked as a saleswoman in a shop for 5 years, but when she decided to get married,  she could no longer keep working because she took on the role of mother in her home. She is not currently working because she is pregnant, but her life partner cultivates corn in 3,500 square meters (a little less than 1 acre) and also works in bricklaying.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy 10 bags of cement, 200 lb (91 kg) of iron and metal sheets to finish placing the roof of the house that is currently under construction.

This loan will help the client purchase the materials to complete the construction of her home which is already under construction. It needs to be finished because the rains have started and she wants to have a safe place for her child on the way.

Right now, Dinora is living with her mom, but when the house is built she will have a respectable home and they will be a united and independent family with better living conditions for their children.

In the not too distant future, after having her second child, she plans to go out and sell beauty products by catalog, to have another source of income for her family and be able to support her husband with household expenses and be able to pay off the loans that they obtained for the purchase of their home.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of cement, 200 lb (91 kg) of iron and metal sheets to finish placing the roof of the house that is currently under construction.

loans.name: Dimas

texts.es:
Dimas tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero. Se dedica a cultivar la tierra junto a su papá desde que tenia 9 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar individualmente cuando tenia 12 años de edad y en la actualidad también se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde. Luego de sacar esta ultima camada, remodelara la galera y pondrá una granja de gallinas ponedoras con la ayuda de su cuñada que ha recibido talleres sobre el manejo de gallinas ponedoras impartidos por instituciones no gubernamentales (ONG`S)

Dimas compra las pollitas, el concentrado y las vitaminas  en la ciudad, por el difícil acceso de la calle el tiempo estimado en transportar sus insumos es de 2 a 3 horas en autobús.


El dinero que solicita, será invertido para comprar 100 pollitas ponedoras, 6 sacos de concentrado, vacunas y vitaminas para aves, además destinara una parte para la compra de 3 sacos de abono para fertilizar el maíz y la compra de 300 ladrillos rojos para ampliar la galera donde tendrá las pollitas.


Al cliente se le apoyara con el crédito a obtener los insumos y materiales para construir una galera mas amplia y pueda tener sus pollitas en un lugar adecuado ya que cuenta con los conocimientos adecuados para el manejo de gallinas ponedoras. Contribuyendo a su desarrollo en cuanto a la producción de huevos y su alimentación, porque  tendrá una fuente de ingresos mucho mayor y podrá comercializar sus productos en el mismo cantón, además tendrá una cosecha de granos básicos con los que mantendrá a su familia. 

Dimas quiere tener una granja de gallinas ponedoras que le generen ingresos y que sea rentable para así poder sacar a su familia adelante y poder remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Dimas is 54 years old, and he is unmarried. He has been cultivating the land with his father since he was nine years old, and he started to work on his own when he was 12. He is currently raising broiler hens. After taking the last litter, he will remodel the hen house and make a farm for laying hens with the help of his sister-in-law who has received workshops on the upkeep of laying hens given by NGOs.

Dimas buys the chickens, the feed, and the vitamins in the city. Because the street is inaccessible, the estimated time of transporting his supplies is 2-3 hours in bus.

The money he is requesting will be invested to buy 100 laying hens, 6 bags of feed, and the vaccines and vitamins for the birds. He will also set aside part of the money to purchase three sacks of fertilizer to fertilize the corn and 300 red bricks to expand the chicken pen where he will have the hens.

The credit will help the client procure the supplies and materials to build a bigger chicken pen and to be able to have his chickens in a suitable place now that he has enough knowledge about maintaining laying hens. Dimas is contributing to his development in terms of feeding and egg production because he will have a much greater source of income, and he will be able to sell his products in the same county. Dimas will also have a harvest of staple grains which will sustain his family.
