Sreytouch hopes that she can double her crop output and earn a good income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús es una mujer de 54 años de edad, con un matrimonio sólido y madre de una hija mayor de edad la cual vive con ellos y ayuda en los quehaceres domésticos en el hogar. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que hace más de 20 años trabaja la tierra por lo cual agradece a sus padres por haberle enseñado a trabajar ya que en su familia la agricultura es una tradición y un medio de ingreso económico único para el sustento familiar. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarla en ese aspecto de su vida. El cultivo de café es una actividad agrícola que de ser tratada a tiempo, de darle mantenimiento entre otros se pueden obtener buenas ganancias por lo tanto el día de hoy Teresa de Jesús ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos que ayudaran a tener su cultivo limpio, sano y libre de plagas que puedan dañarlo.

Sus planes a futuro son los de seguir mejorando sus cultivos, tecnificarlos y seguir cuidándolos para que se mantengan sanos y no perder credibilidad ante sus clientes mismos que son los intermediarios entre otros que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 54 years old and has a solid marriage.  She has a daughter who is now an adult, but who still lives with her parents and helps with household chores.  Teresa has a lot of experience as she has been working the land for over twenty years.  She is grateful to her parents who taught her this work, as farming is a tradition in the family and a source of income for supporting the household.  Teresa did not go to school as her parents were very poor and could not support her with education costs.  Growing coffee is something that, if you take your time and maintain the crops, can provide a good profit.  So, today, Teresa is applying for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to buy supplies to help keep the crops clean, healthy and to avoid diseases that could damage them.

Teresa's future plans are to continue improving her crops and to continue looking after them so that they remain healthy.  She wants to make the coffe-growing process more technical and she does not want to lose credibility in her customers' eyes.  Teresa's customers include wholesalers who come to the area looking for a good quality product.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 21 años, vive con su mamá y sus 6 hermanos, a los que quiere y aprecia en la casa de sus padres. Está joven señorita, hábil y con mucho futuro. Estudia en el instituto de bellas artes de su localidad, donde está aprendiendo a pintar hermosos cuadros, pues el arte lo lleva en la vena, ya que su familia se dedica a la artesanía. Según cuenta le falta 2 años para culminar sus estudios; pero desde ahora pinta hermosos cuadros al óleo; los cuales comercializa a buen precio. Además de dedicarse al bordado de disfraces, faldas y manteles. Ya tienen dos años emprendiendo su propio negocio y según afirma le va muy bien y cada día tienen más pedidos. Ahora ella quiere trabajar muy duro, para expandir su negocio y juntar el dinero necesario para poder estudiar la carrera de gastronomía, pues es otro de sus sueños. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA,y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido, además se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.    Rocío; invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de telas, hilos de colores, blondas, lanas de diversos colores para la realización de sus trabajos.
texts.en: Rocío is 21 years old and lives at her parents' house with her mother and six siblings, whom she loves and appreciates.  This skilled young woman has a good future ahead of her.  She is studying at the local art school, learning to paint beautiful pictures.  Rocío has art in her blood, with the whole family working with artisan products.  Rocío tells us that she has two years left before she finishes her studies but she is already producing wonderful oil paintings, which she sells at a very good price.  In addition, Rocío makes fancy dress costumes, skirts and tablecloths.  She has had her business for two years and assures us that it is going very well, as she is receiving more and more orders every day.  She now wants to work very hard in order to expand her business and save up the necessary money to study cooking, another of her dreams.  This will be Rocío's fourth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the support she is being given. She promises to make her repayments on time.  Rocío will invest the 1500 Nuevo Soles in buying material, coloured threads, blond lace and wool of varying colours for her work.

loans.use: to buy material, coloured threads, blond lace and wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is a 50-year-old mother of six children. She lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. 

Seng grows rice on three hectares of farmland. During their free time, her husband also works for others for a fee to supplement the family’s income. Seng has owned this business for three years.  

This is Seng's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her previous loan, which she has completely repaid, has helped her to earn a better income to sustain her living conditions. Seng is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy five sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more profits, so that she can save some money for when she gets old.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potash and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Teriya est un groupe qui regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de légume à l’image de AMI qui est la première personne debout de  la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU  dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
AMI, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de légume de condiment. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, cube maggi.et des poissons séchés).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Teriya is a group of four women who all came to know one other through family and neighbourhood links. They have an average age of 40. Married with on average five children, they conduct various activities, such the trading of condiments and vegetables as in the case of Ami, who is the person standing on the far left of the photo.
The women live in large, traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the county of Kati (in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali). They have been trading locally for several years and are are in great demand for their products and services.
With a view to meeting the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their fifth mutual loan. Ami, who is the group leader and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the selling of vegetables and condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase a variety of condiments (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, stock cubes and dried fish). She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her food products in Ouelessebougou - retail - for both cash and credit, to both men and women.
She is hoping for a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, an amount which will allow her to repay the loan, and to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, aged eleven and seven. Faith's husband works as a clerk within the town council, while Faith manages the wheat farm as well as running their small shop.

Faith has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now servicing a second loan of KES 60,000. The funds have been used to hire a tractor as well as to purchase fertilizer for the wheat plantation. She will use the income proceeds to educate her children.

Faith hopes to expand her shop from the gains earned from the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for tractor hire.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is 45 years old, and is married with four children. He is a tricycle driver providing transport services in his village, where he earns P400 a day.  He has been in this business for ten years and wants to increase his income and continue to provide safe and good services to all his passengers.  

Benito would like to borrow an additional capital of P8,000 from the lenders to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle.

Benito hopes to achieve economic stability and give his family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 57 years old and is married with three children. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Editha aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar laborando en su actividad; este le permitirá comprar maíz, azúcar, entre otros productos para realizar sus ventas en el negocio.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y con las ganancias, ha logrado brindarle el apoyo a sus hijos en los estudios; las condiciones económicas y circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
María needs to take out a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue working in her business.  This loan will allow her to buy corn, sugar and other products she needs to make her sales.

María's previous loan helped her to improve her income and she has managed to use her profits to support her children in their studies.  Her financial situation and family situation have both improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar and other products

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 46 years old, and is married with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a policeman for twenty years. 

With his little salary he has been able to support his family. He hopes that all his children will finish school. However, his main source of income is his salary, and delayed payment is a challenge. Wilson is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: José Ezequiel

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es una persona trabajadora que vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura y otras labores que generen ingresos para su familia. Pero desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, todo comenzó con la idea de realizar su boda con la persona que hoy es su esposa, pensaron en ahorrar un dinero comprando 70 pollos de engorde y sin saber nada del tiempo que tardaba en desarrollarse el pollo lo hicieron. Y tuvieron que vender los 70 pollos por que se engordaron antes de la fecha de su boda. Y es así como iniciaron su negocio.
Los insumos como concentrados, vitaminas y vacunas los compra en el Municipio; porque es el único lugar donde el cliente obtiene buen precio y tiene asesoría técnica para su producción. Para llegar a este lugar tiene que viajar una distancia de 5 kilómetros en autobús o en pick-up.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 quintales de concentrado para iniciar el desarrollo de un lote de pollos y la otra parte para comprar insumos agrícolas. 

Sus planes a futuro es tener una galera donde pueda desarrollar mas pollos y darles mantenimiento en mejores condiciones para lograr mayores rendimientos económicos y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y cubrir la demanda de los pollos.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a hard-working person who lives with his wife and two children.  José works as a farmer and also carries out additional work to make income for his family.  For the past four years, he has been raising chickens for meat.  It all started with the idea of marrying the woman who is now his wife.  The couple decided to save some money on their wedding by purchasing 70 chickens to fatten themselves and, without knowing anything about the amount of time it takes a chicken to grow, they did this.  They had to sell the 70 chickens because they developed before their wedding date.  This is how they started their business.  The couple buy the supplies they need such as concentrated feed, vitamins and vaccines in Sensuntepeque because it is the only place where customers receive a good price and technical advice.  To reach this place, José has to travel 5km by bus or pick-up truck.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy four 100lb bags of concentrate to feed a batch of chickens.  He will use the remaining money to buy farm supplies.

José's future plans are to build a shed where he can raise more chickens and provide them with better conditions.  This will make him more money and he will be able to both satisfy his family's needs and cover his demand for chickens.

loans.use: to buy four 100lb bags of concentrate to feed his chickens, and to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Bunry's Group

texts.en:
Bunry is a local villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province. He is father of one little girl. 

To provide for his family, Bunry manages four hectares of cassava farming, which he has had for six years. 

This is Bunry's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is leading the group of two to apply for a loan. He and his joint member are seeking a loans of 4,000,000 KHR and 3,000,000 KHR, respectively. Bunry will use his loan portion to plow his farmland, pay for labor costs, buy insecticide and cassava seedling. He hopes that he can make more income in order to save more money for his daughter’s education costs in the future.

loans.use: to plow his farmland, pay for labor costs, buy insecticide and cassava seedling.

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en:
Karlen was born in and still lives in the sunny and beautiful village of Artsvanik, which is in the Syunik region of Armenia. He has higher technical education and now works at the Kajaran Copper Molybdenum Combine as an engineer. 

Karlen is married, and he lives with his wife and son. His elder son is married and lives with his own family separately. 

From an early age, Karlen has been involved in agriculture and farming. He owns a plot of land and some farm animals. Karlen cultivates crops and a large variety of vegetables: potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, radish and greens. He receives a decent income from selling his garden harvest, meat and milk to re-sellers at the cities of Kapan and Kajaran. Karlen also breeds from his two cows, two bulls, two calves, a horse and ten chickens.

Karlen has requested a loan of 1,100,000 AMD to buy animal fodder and fertilizer. He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him as well as many other farmers who have had a great success by the help of given loans.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Elsa earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 71 años de edad, es viudo y tiene cinco hijos. Es una persona trabajadora y muy humilde, que desde pequeño nunca tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a su padre y para el fue muy difícil crecer si un padre; por ser el primer hijo varón de su madre fue quien le ayudo a cultivar y trabajar para la familia y desde que tenía 15 años de edad, inicio cultivando su primera milpa y desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar, la agricultura y nadie le enseño todos los conocimientos que hoy tiene los adquirió al ver la necesidad de sus hermanos y su madre.
Como todo agricultor de la zona  compra los insumos, donde mejor precio le den y pueda ahorrar un par de pesos, debe de viajar desde la comunidad en pick-up durante 30 minutos. Para llegar hasta el lugar donde adquiere los insumos y eso tiene un costo por que tiene que pagar para que le lleven los productos hasta donde vive y de ahí los carga en su espalda hasta que los lleva a su humilde casa.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 sacos de fertilizantes, semilla de maíz, herbicidas y fungicidas para el control de plagas y malezas que puedan dañar su cultivo. También invertirá en la mano de obra para la preparación del terreno.

Con el préstamo, dispondrá de  los productos necesarios, para el mantenimiento adecuado de su cultivo y con eso obtener una mejor cosecha de calidad que supere los niveles de productividad de la zona y sea hasta más fácil su venta.


Su deseo es, ayudar a sus nietos a que aprendan a ganarse la vida humildemente y puedan superarse en esta vida.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 71 years old, widowed, and has five children.  He is a hard-working, very humble person who never had the chance to know his father.  It was very difficult for Gregorio growing up without a father and, because he was the eldest son, he was the one who had to help his mother to farm and work for the family.  He started growing his first field of corn at the age of 15 and hasn't stopped working since.  Nobody taught him all the things he knows about farming.  He learned them because he could see the needs of his siblings and mother.

In common with other farmers in his area, Gregorio buys his supplies wherever he can get them at the best price and save a few pesos.  He has to travel around 30 minutes by pick-up truck from his community to get to the place where he buys his supplies and this has its price because he has to pay for them to deliver the products to his property, where he loads them onto his back and carries them to his humble home.

Gregorio is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy three sacks of fertilizer, corn seeds, and herbicides and fungicides to control pests and weeds that can damage his crops.  He will also pay laborers to prepare his land.

With this loan, Gregorio will have all the products he needs to adequately care for his crops.  This will allow him to achieve a better, good-quality harvest that will beat local productivity levels and his sales will be easier.

Gregorio would like to help his grandchildren to learn to earn a modest living.  He hopes that they will do well in life.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizers, corn seeds, and herbicides and fungicides to control pests and weeds that can harm his crops.  He will also pay laborers to prepare his land

loans.name: Koitat

texts.en:
Koitat is 42 years old, married to Kibiyoto and blessed with six children, which he supports. 

He is a wheat farmer in the Naituyupaki area and has been in the farming business for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 30,000 monthly. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, which will facilitate land preparation and enable him to purchase farm supplies to help obtain better yields.

He intends to use the anticipated profits to support his business and provide for his family's basic needs. His future dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Vicente De Jesus

texts.es:
Vicente, tiene 48 años de edad y está acompañado. El, se dedica a la agricultura y realiza  el cultivo de maíz para obtener ingresos necesarios y mantener su hogar, este oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo desempeña de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00pm, asimimo posee un taller de estructuras metalicas.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas adecuados tales como: semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros; esto le ayudara a tener la capacidad de mayor inversión e incrementar sus ganancias.
Su deseo es fortalecer el negocio para optimizar su situación económica y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Vicente is 48 years old and lives with his partner.  He is a farmer and grows corn to make the income he needs to support his household.  He learned this trade from his parents and works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.00am to 12.00pm.  He also owns a metal shop.

Vicente needs this loan to buy farm supplies such as corn seed, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and other products.  This will help him to invest more in his business and increase his profits.

Vicente would like to strengthen his business so that he can improve his financial situation and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Lorena Beatriz

texts.es: Doña Lorena, es una señora de 35 años de edad, casada tiene dos hijos, en la actualidad ella no trabaja solamente su esposo se encarga de los gastos del hogar, Lorena para apoyar a su familia se está dedicando a estudiar, ya que antes no pudo por estar trabajando ahora que se le presento la oportunidad de realizar una carrera en Licenciatura en Psicología Clínica desea aprovechar al máximo para prepararse, está solicitando el crédito para pagar  el curso de titulación, lo que le permitirá realizarse como toda una mujer profesional y sería un punto de apoyo a su familia y a la comunidad.
texts.en: Lorena is 35 and married with two children  At the moment she is not working and it is her husband who is responsible for the household expenses.  In order to support her family Lorena is studying, as she was unable to do so earlier because she was working.  Now that a chance has come up to do a Clinical Psychology degree, she wants to take every opportunity to prepare.  She is, therefore, applying for a loan to pay for the degree course, which will allow her to become a professional woman and would be a means of support for her family and the wider community.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wool in varied colors.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
This is Visitacion, age 46, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, an employee. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Visitacion operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. She also has a direct selling business and a laundry shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products.

Visitacion hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 26-year-old married woman with one child living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been in the salon business for seven years and works 10 hours a day located on a busy street. She started the business in order to raise money to support her family. 

She hopes to expand her business into new areas, despite the lack of enough capital. Sylivia intends to use the loan to buy synthetic hair, a hair dryer and cosmetics to use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair, a hair dryer and cosmetics to use in the salon

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo, ya que cultiva granos básicos y hortalizas; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El efecto del préstamo anterior le ayudo en gran medida, ya que la producción aumento y sus ingresos los invierte en los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
José needs to take out a new loan because he needs more working capital.  He grows basic grains and vegetables.  This loan will allow him to buy the farm supplies he needs such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

José's previous loan helped him a lot.  His yield increased and he invested his income in covering his household expenses.  Both his financial situation and his family situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Originally from Sangke district of Battambang province, Ran is 37 years old and married. She is blessed with four kids who currently are students at a local state school. To make a living, she sells food including rice and porridge as her main source of income. Her husband also helps her to earn more income by driving a motor-taxi for a fee. With this loan, she is a second-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the first successful loan which she has repaid completely, she can relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood better than before and, in particular, she can keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy more ingredients for her food-selling business including rice and meat. She hopes that she can make more profit from her business so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food-selling business including rice and meat.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Martha es soltera, 37 años de edad y  con un hijo su negocio es la venta de calzado desde hace 3 años, y venta de tamarindo, el calzado lo vende en su comunidad y el tamarindo lo comercializa en el mercado de Masaya, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tamarindo, Francisca es otra socia y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Petrona tiene 54 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of them is Martha, who is 37, single and the mother of one child.  She has been selling footwear and tamarinds for 3 years.  She sells the footwear within her community and tamarinds at Masaya market  She will use the loan to buy tamarinds. The other members of the group are Francisca, who sells fruit and vegetables, and 54-year-old Petrona, who sells fruit.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. 

Gina is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Gina has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for four years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gina would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Mary Jane has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, eggs, laundry soap, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan,  tiene 33 años de edad y vive con sus padres. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para obtener ingresos y cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar, el oficio lo aprendió con sus padres desde pequeño y lo lleva a cabo de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros; este le servirá para aumentar la productividad y sus utilidades.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old and lives with his parents. He works growing basic grains to earn income and cover the basic household expenses. He has learned he trade from his parents since he was very small and does it Monday through Saturday from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

The loan he needs will allow hi to buy the agricultural materials he needs, such as: fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and more. This will allow him to increase productivity and profits. His dream is to improve financially to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and more.

loans.name: Damaris Esther

texts.es:
Damaris, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y por la forma de pago que la Institución brinda; este le permitirá comprar material de bisutería tales como: nailon, perlas, plástico, asimismo cadenas enchapadas, collares, pulseras, anillos, entre otros. 
El efecto del crédito anterior le genero mayores ingresos, ya que logro adquirir material para el negocio y tener más inventario para poder cumplir con la demanda del cliente; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Damaris needs to take out another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business.  The repayment format that the institution provides allows her to buy jewelry materials such as nylon, pearls, plastic, plated chains, necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc.

Damaris' previous loan made her more income because she managed to buy materials for her business and had more stock available which meant that she could meet her customer demand.  Both her financial situation and her family situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy nylon, pearls, plastic, plated chains, necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc.

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
Chanra, 36, is a rural farmer from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has three children to cater for, as they are still in school. 

The main source of her family's income is a dual income, as her husband works for others for a fee, while Chanra earns another income from rice cropping and a pig raising business. 

This is the business that she has had for 10 years, earning about 28,300 KHR per day. Chanra has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles including this loan. The past loan enabled her to improve her living conditions and expand her business at a gradual pace; she has also repaid her past loan with success. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, while her joint member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on buying rice seed to plough into her rice farming business and pig feed. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her businesses on a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy rice seed to plough into her rice farming business and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en:
Ban is 59 years old and a widowed mother of eight children. She strives to earn a living via rice cropping, which she has been doing for 11 years. Ban has been with VisionFund for the past four cycles and has fully repaid back her past loans completely, which has supported her business on time. 

Now, Ban is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. Her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR while her joint member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Ban will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She highly believes that she can increase her income so she can expand her farmland.

loans.use: To plow her farmland.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A hardworking farmer residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sarom is 63 years old and blessed with seven children. Currently, only one child is still in school. 

She earns a living from her three hectares of rice farming, with which she has been engaged for 31 years and is able to earn about 11,100 KHR per day. 

Her past loan was the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which she has fully repaid with success. Her living conditions improved, which is the positive outcome of her past loan. 

Now, she is in a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on buying potash for her crop. She believes that she can expand her business and improve on last year and earn more income to sustain her way of life.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop

loans.name: Brenda Marisela

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven de 21 años de edad con muchos sueños, muchas metas y muchas esperanzas de poder cumplir todas y cada una de ellas. Ella es casada con un grado de secundaria completa graduándose como maestra de educación primaria la cual no la desempeña por la falta de empleo y plazas en cada una de las instituciones en la zona donde ella habita. Su único apoyo es su pareja que actualmente él se desempeña como mecánico automotriz en un taller de la zona el cual es muy reconocido y con mucho prestigio. Con el apoyo de él, ella ha decido emprender un negocio el cual es la compra/venta de mercadería en general como: Lociones, maquillaje, aceite para motor de motocicleta y carro, etc. De ellos no depende nadie por lo tanto es un poco más fácil el sustento familiar y poder dar mantenimiento y comprar productos en pequeña escala para su negocio.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento a COMIXMUL parta la compra de mercadería en general ya que la demanda de su negocio está creciendo y necesita inyectarle a su negocio un poco más de capital e invertirlo en productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.  

Sus planes es poder seguir gozando de los beneficios que la cooperativa ofrece por sus tasas bajas de interés para cumplir su sueño de abrir una tienda de mercadería ya que actualmente elle vende de casa en casa sus productos desplazándose a las diferentes zonas de su municipio.
texts.en:
Brenda is a young woman of 21 who has a lot of dreams and goals.  She is very hopeful that she will be able to fulfill each and every one of them.  Brenda is married and completed her secondary education, graduating as an elementary school teacher.  She does not work as a teacher as there were no jobs in any of the schools in her area.  Her only support is her husband who works as a car mechanic in a well-known, very prestigious auto repair shop in her area.  With his support, Brenda has decided to set up a business buying and selling general merchandise such as lotions, make-up, motorcycle oil, car oil, etc.  The couple have no dependents so it is a little easier to support their family and Brenda is able to buy products on a small scale for her business.

Brenda is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL to buy general merchandise as her demand is growing and she needs to inject a little more capital into her business and invest in products to sell to her customers.

Brenda's plans are to continue enjoying the benefits offered by the cooperative with their low interest rates.  She hopes to fulfill her dream of opening a general store as she currently sells her products door to door, travelling to different areas of her town.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is a 57 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has 6 children and the youngest is 15.  She runs a retail store.  She sells items like biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, bread, coconut wine and soaps.  She has been operating a retail store for more than 10 years now. 

Celedonia requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks and beverages to avoid stock shortage and to cater to the needs of her customers.  In the future,  Celedonia would like to expand her retail store business to support her family and also to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks and beverages

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a cash crop farmer in Oloitoktok town.  She specializes in crops such as maize and beans.  She also plants vegetables to sell.  Beatrice is 37 years old and married with 2 children.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting during this rainy season.  She anticipates making more income with which she will use to buy more farm inputs such as insecticides and tilling tools.

She hopes to improve her farming methods and be successful in her farming business hence make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Donata

texts.en: Donata is a fifty three year old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She deals in the craft business and also does agriculture for additional income.  She dreams of expanding her business to new areas, however, delays in getting raw materials is her challenge.  Donata will use the loan to buy raw materials for making crafts.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Claudia Marisol

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Es ama de casa vive con su compañero de vida, quien se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, además  vive con su hijo de un año y tres meses es una mujer dedicada a los oficios del hogar que está al pendiente de su esposo y su hijo en todo momento.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los materiales para la construcción de un muro al frente de su casa. Con la inversión, estará más segura tanto ella como su familia y así su hijo podrá jugar libremente y sin riesgo a los alrededores de la casa, evitando problemas de los vehículos y animales que transitan por la zona. 

Mejorara grandemente sus condiciones de seguridad; ya que sin el muro estaba propensa a cualquier situación de riesgo tanto ella como su familia. Después, de la construcción del muro de su casa quiere construir un corredor en su hogar; ya que quiere ampliar su vivienda para que  su familia este más cómoda y su hijo jugara con mayor seguridad dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is 23 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has a son. She is a house wife and lives with her life's companion, who works in agriculture.  She also lives with her fifteen month old son. She is a woman who cares for the home and is watching over her husband and son at all times. 

The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy construction materials for a wall in front of her house. With the investment, both she and her family will be safer and her son can play freely and risk free around the house, avoiding problems with vehicles and animals that are in the area. 

She will gradually improve her security conditions, since without the wall she and her family were vulnerable to any risky situation. After building the wall, she wants to build a hallway in her house, since she wants to expand it so her family is more comfortable and he son can play more safely inside the house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Ida Armenia

texts.en:
Ida Armenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen food business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell to customers.

Ida Armenia has been in this business for four years.  Ida Armenia earns more income from rice retailing.  Ida Armenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods  to sell.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay, age 53, is the mother of nine children; three of whom are still in school.  Now, her main source of income is from the pig-raising business.  This is not the first loan for Lay with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid back her previous loans with great success and it has enabled her to increase her income, up to 47,200 KHR per day so she can afford to buy a decent motorbike for commuting as well as to support her business. 

Now, she is in a group of four applying for a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more pigs for raising.  She hopes that this business keeps growing so that she can make more income to expand this business to a bigger scale.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for raising

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, age 49 is the mother of eight children, who is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  Nowadays, she needs to support only three children as they are still in school.  Her two hectares of rice farming, which she has had for 12 years, has generated her about 9,800 KHR per day. 

Ly is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each.   After the past loan which she has fully repaid back, she feels confident that she can upgrade her living conditions.  For this cycle, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for her plowing fee.  She hopes that she can gain a higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for her plowing fee

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome works hard to support her family.  Salome is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Salome requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Salome has been in this business for 20 years now.  Salome would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, a mother of three children, is 53 years old and a rice grower on two hectares of land as the main source of income to deal with the daily cost of living. She has been engaged in the current business for 15 years.  

Touch is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and currently leads a group of three to apply for a new loan in the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland.  She highly believes that she can make more income than before to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años de edad. Es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, pasteles, yuca, etc., negocio en el cual  lleva más de 3 años. Para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de la venta, depende del producto que valla a vender ya que no puede comprar el producto para tenerlo almacenado sino que las compras son cada dos días.

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar hierro y lamina para colocar el techo de su casa.  Con el préstamo, cubrirá la necesidad de la falta de techo de su vivienda; así ya no estará alquilando y  junto a su madre estarán bajo un techo seguro. Sus condiciones de vida mejoraran grandemente; ya que estarán en su propia vivienda, estarán seguras y podrán tener mejores comodidades 

A futuro quiere construir una habitación para su hijo, además de la construcción de una cocina y el mejoramiento de su horno, para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Reina is 29 years old and is a single mother to her five-year-old son.  Reina is an enterprising woman who makes a living selling chips, cakes, yucca and more.  She has had this business for over three years.  In order to buy basic materials for making her products, Reina depends on items that she goes out to sell as she cannot store the products.  So, she makes her purchases every day.

Reina is applying to this loan from "Fundación Campo" in order to buy iron and sheets of metal to put a roof on her house.  With this loan she will be able to fulfill her need for a roof on her home. With this, Reina will no longer have to rent and she will be able to live alongside her mother, under a safe roof.                                   Reina and her mother's living conditions have improved greatly as they will be in their own home.  They will be more secure and will be more comfortable.

In the future, Reina would like to build a room for her son, as well as a kitchen and to have a better oven in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy iron and metal sheets to put a roof on her house.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne  46 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  Lafiabougou un des quartiers de la ville de SAN (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 13 eme  prêt solidaire. KADIA 1 ère femme  de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires pour faire la restauration. Elle compte acheter 3 sacs de farine 2 bidons de vingt litres un sac d’oignon et les ingrédients indispensables à la restauration.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à SAN et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes(plats alimentaires), sur place à SAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Djekafo group are 46 years old on average, and have an average of six children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the neighbourhoods in the town of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and involved in various business activities. This includes trading food products, such as condiments, and catering.

Having successfully repaid all their previous loans, the women in the Djekafo group are requesting their 13th solidarity loan. Kadia, pictured on the far left, will use her part of the loan to buy food supplies to use in her catering business. She will buy three sacks of flour, two 20-liter cans of oil, a bag of onions and other essential ingredients.

The women buy their supplies in San and the surrounding villages. They sell prepared dishes in San to both men and women customers.

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 75 500 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her catering business.
